 Vi inkluderar och välkomnar alla oavsett roll, funktion eller ansvar. Vi värderar kompetens och har förtroende för att individen tar eget ansvar och levererar inom ramen för sin rollbeskrivning. Vi är prestigelösa och vårt arbetsklimat bygger på öppenhet och trygghet.
   

  

**Knowledge |** 
 Vi har ett "growth mindset" och håller oss relevanta på marknaden genom att ständigt förflytta och höja vår egen kompetens, våra konsulters samt våra lösningar/erbjudanden.
   

  

**Innovation |** 
 Vi vågar testa nytt och misslyckas. Det kräver mod. Vi har ett utifrån och in-fokus och arbetar hela tiden med värdeskapande aktiviteter för våra målgrupper.
   

  

 Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?
   

  

 På Experis är vi stolta över våra konsulter och tillsammans hittar vi rätt utmaningar för dig. Vi har höga förväntningar på dig, men i gengäld erbjuder vi dig goda utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter. Förutom möjligheten att utveckla dina kunskaper ute på spännande uppdrag erbjuds du provanställning enligt kollektivavtal, marknadsmässig månadslön, reglerad semester och semestersättning, friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och försäkring, samt många andra förmåner - precis som det alltid ska vara
   

  

**Vi ser framemot att höra från dig!**
 Låter detta som något för dig? Kontakta Vilma på mailadress vilma.andersson@se.experis.com för att höra mer om vad vi har att erbjuda!
   

  

 Vänta inte, låt IT-äventyret börja! 🚀

title: Quality Manager to Coca-Cola Europacific Partners Sweden!
description:
**About Us**
 Coca-Cola Europacific Partners is one of the leading consumer goods companies in the world with a dedicated team of 42,000 people, who work together with manufacture, distribution, sales and industry marketing of Coca-Cola in 31 countries. In Sweden, we are around 750 committed colleagues at our production site and head office (also called "Happiness Factory") in Haninge outside Stockholm. CCEP Sweden represents some of the beverage world's strongest brands such as Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Powerade and Monster, but also strong local brands such as bonaqua and Mer.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Quality Manager at Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) you will have a dynamic and important key role where you interact broadly across functions and manage the quality support within the Swedish organization. Through your team consisting of 4 dedicated and competent people that you lead, you will ensure that the quality work meets the high level of standard within CCEP. Your main focus will be to lead and develop the quality work within our Supply Chain organization, which includes everything from raw material suppliers, production, maintenance, warehouse and distribution to complaints from customers and consumers. With your tactical capabilities, ability to act, energy and determination, you will contribute to CCEP’s continuous development and exciting journey as the world’s largest independent Coca-Cola bottler. You will report to Sr QESH Manager and the position is placed in Jordbro, Stockholm.
   

  

 In this role you will be expected to:
   

  

* Deliver a well-established priority plan of what is most important within your area of responsibility
* Provide a strategic plan regarding improvements that needs to be implemented – a plan on management level, supported by detailed underlying plans
* Deliver clear follow-ups and reporting on a monthly basis, or more often if needed
* Work with individual projects that aims to create structural change
* Work with the Quality community across CCEP and Northern Europe Business (NEBU) unit in particular
* Ensure fast and clear management and communication in case of emergency events or crisis within your area of responsibility


 This together will contribute to a continuous change over time, visible as a change of culture within your area of responsibility.
   

  

**Who are we looking for?**
 We are consider it as requirements that you have:
   

  

* A relevant academic degree
* Several years of documented experience within Quality and Food Safety (HACCP)
* Knowledge and experience from working in management systems
* Knowledge and excellent skills within project management
* Knowledge in Swedish law regarding the different areas of responsibilities
* Fluent skills in English and Swedish


 To succeed and thrive in this role we believe that you:
   

  

* Are analytical with an ability to see patterns and trends in data. At the same time you also have the ability to see and communicate the bigger picture
* Are an excellent communicator. You know how to adapt you communication
* A person who has the knowledge and the ability to influence others
* Has the ability to handle potential conflicts in a proactive way
* Are a committed person who doesn’t face setbacks without finding inspiration to lead your organization towards the long-term goals. You are goal-oriented and driven by reaching set goals
* Have a passion for what you do which affects others. This also means that it is noticeable that you embrace the values you pursue in your organisation
* Know how to say no and stand up for your cause in a way that is clear and that increases your credibility, feels comfortable taking decisions based on data at hand
* Enjoy working in a high-paced environment where everything progresses very quickly. You adapt easily when circumstances change


**If this sounds like your kind of challenge, apply today!**
 Attach your CV and cover letter by using the application link. If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Hellen Song, hsong@ccep.com. Please note that we do not accept applications through e-mail, due to GDPR.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) is a major fast-moving consumer goods business and the world’s largest independent Coca-Cola bottler. We usually say,
 **“You may join the brand, but stay for the people”** 
 , and it really is! With us, you get the opportunity to grow in a fast and innovative industry, together with our employees, consumers and customers. You get a lot of own responsibility from day one and the opportunity to really make a difference. Our recipe for success is that we are passionate, hard-working and committed to our products, our customers and each other. CCEP is a place where people can grow, be happy and be well in a safe, open and inclusive workplace. We value a diverse workforce and welcome you to apply regardless of gender, age or ethnicity. If you are interested in the stories of the people behind our beverages, please visit https://www.coca-cola.se/100voices.

title: Category Sourcing Manager (IT & Software)
description:
**Why Join Us?** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
 



  





 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
 



  





 As a Sourcing Manager, you will join our global Sourcing team, who is responsible for both project sourcing and strategic sourcing and supports all business units as a group function, including affiliate companies. In this role, you'll be managing and optimizing IT and software-related agreements, including enterprise software licenses, SaaS, IT services, infrastructure, and digital tools.
 



  





 You'll have the opportunity to work on both category and supplier management, driving cost efficiency, ensuring compliance, and aligning with IT and business needs. To support best-in-class supplier management and indirect sourcing processes, you'll collaborate closely with the IT department and key stakeholders across the organization.
 



  





**In this role, you will:** 



* Lead sourcing activities for IT and software, including enterprise software licenses, SaaS, IT services, and cloud solutions.
* Negotiate and manage software agreements, ensuring cost optimization, compliance, and risk mitigation.
* Run RFx processes to identify, evaluate, and select the best IT and software suppliers.
* Develop and implement supplier governance frameworks to track performance and drive continuous improvement.
* Ensure compliance with procurement policies, data security, and software license regulations.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders to align sourcing strategies with IT and business needs.
* Manage supplier relationships to ensure service quality, cost efficiency, and contractual compliance.



  





**Please note:** 
 This role may include occasional (10%) domestic or international travel which would be communicated weeks in advance.
 



  





**What We're Looking For:** 




 We are looking for a sourcing professional with strong negotiation skills who has a solid grasp of IT and software sourcing to drive our
 **indirect sourcing activities.** 




  





**We are looking for someone that has:** 



* 3+ years of experience in sourcing, procurement, or vendor management roles within IT, software, or technology procurement.
* Experience with managing software license agreements, SaaS contracts or IT service agreements.
* Experience with running RFx processes and supplier evaluations for IT and software solutions.
* Foundational understanding of procurement methods, contract management, risk assessment, and supplier governance.
* Strong negotiation skills and ability to drive cost savings while ensuring high service quality.
* Proactivity, analytical mindset, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent communication skills in English (both written and verbal) and ability to collaborate cross-functionally.



  





**Our Values:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
 



  





**What We Offer:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
 


* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Integrationsutvecklare
description:
Vill du vara med och göra samhället möjligt på en av Sveriges största IT-avdelningar? Skatteverket erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsmiljö där du tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor skapar samhällsnytta.
   

  

 Vi söker nu integrationsutvecklare med ansvar för att utveckla och testa integrationer både inom Skatteverket och mot andra myndigheter. I denna roll kommer du att vara en nyckelperson i arbetet med att säkerställa robusta och säkra integrationer.
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som integrationsutvecklare med ansvar för tekniska tester arbetar du i ett agilt team med utveckling och förvaltning av integrationer. Du får möjlighet att arbeta med varierande uppgifter i en teknisk miljö som idag omfattar bland annat Oracle och Informatica Power Center, samt andra integrationstekniker.
   

  

 I samverkan med team som hanterar mål- och källsystem levererar du högkvalitativa integrationer. Du arbetar både självständigt och i team, där samarbete och prestigelöshet är centrala faktorer för framgång. Vi befinner oss i en pågående systemförnyelse där vi inför modern teknik och utvecklar vår arkitektur.
   

  

 Tillsammans med dina kollegor har du roligt på jobbet samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnytta. Du har frihet och eget ansvar att bidra till nya lösningar. Vi är en stor it-avdelning som erbjuder dig utvecklingsmöjligheter både på djupet och på bredden. Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du har balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att jobba med it hos oss och ta del av vad några av våra medarbetare berättar om sina jobb: Jobba med it hos oss
   

  

 Du tillhör it-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och öppen för förändringar
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga, se mönster och kunna göra avgränsningar
* vara målfokuserad och bidra till att syftet med verksamheten uppnås
* agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt
* uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT alternativt flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant
* flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av integrationsutveckling
* flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av test
* flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av SQL


 Det är önskvärt att du har erfarenhet och kunskap av Linux och Oracle. Det är också önskvärt att du har erfarenhet av ETL-utveckling i Informatica Power Center eller liknande.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/262 | Kontakt: Tomas Stjernholm, sektionschef tomas.stjernholm@skatteverket.se, Maria-Claudia Sun Han Cordova, hr-specialist maria-claudia.sun.han.cordova@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, Therese Sjödin, Seko therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-04-04 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-19

title: Tech Leads
description:
Bankgirot söker nu nya medarbetare till en växande del av organisationen.
   

  

 Bankgirot har en unik ställning på Sveriges betalmarknad som nu genomgår den största transformationen i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation är i en tillväxtfas för att utveckla framtidssäkrade lösningar som följer internationell standard och regelverk. Samtidigt ser vi till att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar säkert och stabilt – varje dag.
   

  

 Arbetet med att utveckla framtidens betalinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi behöver dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som medarbetare kommer du att spela en viktig roll i uppdraget att säkerställa framtidens betalinfrastruktur på ett teknikbolag där vi har ett stort hjärta för uppdraget – och varandra.
   

  

 Nu söker vi Tech Leads inom ett flertal olika teknikområden.
   

  

 I dessa rekryteringar samarbetar Bankgirot med olika samarbetspartners. Klicka vidare på länkarna nedan för att läsa mer och ansöka hos respektive bolag:
   

  

  

* Mainframe
* Microsoft Server


 Vill du vara med på resan att transformera framtidens betalningar? Urval och intervjuer för dessa tjänster kommer att ske löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Ser du inget i den här annonsen som passar dig - se
 **fler lediga tjänster här** 
**!**
 Connecta med Bankgirot så blir du först med att få information om lediga tjänster.
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Delivery Lead / Project Manager – Digital HR solutions
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you passionate about leading digital transformation with real business impact? Do you thrive in global complexity, and love turning ideas into structured action? In the role as
 **Delivery Lead** 
 , you won’t just manage timelines and deliverables, you’ll drive some of our most strategic HR tech initiatives, including the rollout of our global salary review tool and futureproofing how we handle compensation data. You’ll lead initiatives across time zones, tech teams and HR functions as well as operate in one of the world’s most expansive HR tech environments.
   

  

 This is your chance to make a mark in a high-impact role, where hybrid project methodologies meet real global scale and your leadership truly matters.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Lead and deliver large scale digital HR projects with global reach, from concept to implementation.
* Act as a connector between HR and Tech, translating needs into system solutions.
* Apply both agile and traditional project management methods.
* Coordinate cross-functional project teams.
* Drive clarity around scope, goals, timelines and governance.
* Collaborate closely with global stakeholders and steer progress in an evolving landscape.
* Contribute to smarter, more sustainable ways of working across delivery and change.


**Qualifications**
 We believe you are a structured doer with a strategic mind – someone who thrives in navigating both complexity and ambiguity, and who brings people together to get things done. To succeed in this role, you likely bring:
   

  

* Proven experience leading large scale digital projects, ideally within HR or enterprise tech environments.
* Hands-on knowledge of both agile and traditional project management methodologies.
* The ability to lead cross-functional teams without formal leadership.
* Experience working in global, matrix organizations, and navigating the challenges that come with it.
* A background in or passion for HR processes and systems (SAP SuccessFactors or similar is a plus).
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills across seniority levels and cultures.
* A pragmatic mindset, with an eye for both long-term and short-term realities.
* Fluent in English.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible, but no later than 16th of May 2025. We will review and interview candidates ongoing. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through the career page.

title: Icertis Functional Consultant
description:
We are hiring for Icertis Functional Consultant , Candidate is expected to do 3 days onsite / week in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



  





  





**Must have skills:** 




 • 10+ years of experience working on Icertis CLM implementation projects in different capacities.
 



 • Led at full lifecycle, medium to large scale Icertis implementation projects.
 



 • Hands-on experience in solution design, with ability to architect complex systems.
 



 • ability to conduct end to end workshops and whiteboarding.
 



 • Quality assurance and quality control.
 



  





**Description** 




 • Experience in minimum 4 full life cycle Icertis implementations in a lead capacity.
 



 • Be well versed with the contracting lifecycle, sales, and procurement processes.
 



 • have strong understanding of various project management methodologies especially from compliance POV.
 



 • Take up the consultative approach and provide expert guidance & insights to customers helping them achieve their business objectives.
 



 • Drive a value-oriented approach to ensure the customer derives tangible benefits from the implementation.
 



 • Collaborate with customers to understand their needs & challenges, offering tailored solutions that address their specific requirements, which could include recommending business process changes.
 



 • Have strong stakeholder management skills – to collaborate with internal teams as well as build long-standing relationships with customers, fostering trust throughout the implementation process.
 



 • Demonstrate assertive & effective communication in managing customers’ expectations and addressing concerns.
 



 • Be the primary point of contact for the key business stakeholder of the customer especially around business value, business process and change management.
 



 • Have extensive knowledge of the inner workings of a Icertis Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) software from a solution design, system usability & digital transformation standpoint.
 



 • Have experience of configuring Icertis Biz Apps
 



 • Have extensive know-how of legacy migration process in Icertis
 



 • Have strong proficiency in solution design, system configuration, system testing, user training, hypercare support.
 



 • Should be comfortable in configuring the Icertis system in multiple languages.
 



 • Already possess or be willing to obtain all relevant Icertis certifications in a reasonable timeframe.
 



 • Excellent communication skills (verbal + written) in English language.
 



  





  





  





 Note: No Sponsorship will be provided for this role.
 



  





 Please share your CV's to siva.s@infoplusltd.co.uk
 



  





 #Icertis #Functionalconsultant #Solutiondesign #Stakeholder #Swedenjobs #b2bjobs #Contractjobs #CLM #contractlifecyclemanagement

title: Solution Advisor Senior Specialist, Sweden
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**We help the world run better**
 At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.
   

  

 We are looking for a talented Solution Advisor to join our Digital Supply Chain Team in EMEA, with a strong background in Supply Chain Planning. Experience working within Supply Chain and of delivering projects will really help you to understand our customers requirements and get them excited about the value SAP solutions can bring to them!
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 In this role you will bring well-developed solution and business process knowledge to customers by demonstrating a compelling vision of the future with SAP & partner solutions. You will identify, qualify, and demonstrate how SAP can provide the best solution to achieve customers business outcomes. A key part of this role is the ability to deliver memorable customer experiences with stories that differentiate with business outcomes. The role encompasses the full lifecycle of customer engagement, from supporting business development activities through to supporting renewals for existing customers.
   

  

**Account Team Engagement**
* Engage with customers early in the sales cycle by matching customer needs and vision to SAP solutions and qualifying the opportunity against a probability of success.
* Manage the business process discovery to provide a foundation for the solution recommendations and support the business capability mapping, technical discoveries, and the case for change.
* Support new sales and adoption by providing solution-specific expertise and competitive differentiation.
* Provide expertise to the account team and to the development of the account strategy.
* Contribute to creation of overall theme and competitive differentiation (value wedges) and execute dry runs.
* Engage customers through impactful storytelling.
* Provide answers to customer / internal SAP team inquiries concerning solution topics focusing on driving customer success and business outcomes.
* Embrace consistent messaging and employ digital assets in all customer engagements, including recorded demos, presentations, microsites, and other reusable content.


**Customer Lifecycle Engagement**
* Effectively transition the deal to on-boarding teams / partners
* Drive adoption by continuing to sell the vision and impact of SAP's solutions post-selection.
* Provide expertise through the customers' successful deployments and realization of value, as required.
* Build knowledge across the customer lifecycle.
* Expand the SAP footprint by showing how other SAP solutions can be leveraged to address other areas of their business.


**What You Bring**
 Your focus and experience should be in the Supply Chain Planning area. In particular, extensive experience with SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) or SAP Advanced Planning Optimizer (APO) is essential. Knowledge of competitor solutions would also be advantageous.
   

  

 In particular, we will be looking for people that can demonstrate the following:
   

  

* Extensive experience with SAP Integrated Business Planning or SAP APO
* Good understanding of SAP’s overall portfolio, especially other Digital Supply Chain solutions
* Good knowledge of the competition in the SCM Planning process area and the corresponding SAP solutions (IBP, APO, PP/DS)
* Detailed knowledge of the supply chain environment, especially planning processes and relationships with wider business processes
* Experience of implementing supply chain planning solutions
* Experience in value-based selling, value engineering
* Confidence presenting at C-level and enthusiasm for new and innovative solutions
* Excellent communication and presentation skills as well as experience with innovative presentation elements (e.g. Prezi, video, storytelling, etc.)
* Professional experience in presales, consulting and/or value engineering


 As well as this, you will also be great at:
   

  

* Building a strong network and relationships with colleagues and customers
* Priotising and managing your time effectively
* Continuously learning and developing to enhance and widen your domain expertise
* Being part of the wider SAP team, contributing to our Solution Hubs and helping others to develop


**Meet the Team**
 Working within the EMEA Digital Supply Chain team, you will be working alongside a diverse team covering the entire supply chain portfolio. As a key part of the Nordics market unit, you will also work closely with one of the largest market units within SAP, and therefore some of our largest customers, contributing significantly to the growth of SAP and toward it’s cloud transformation.
   

  

**Bring out your best**
 SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
   

  

**We win with inclusion**
 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
   

  

 SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com
   

  

 For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
   

  

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability**
 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
   

  

 Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
   

  

 Requisition ID: 423722 | Work Area: Presales | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: .

title: Client Partner
company_industry: Utilities Administration and Food and Beverage Services
description:
**About Tata consultancy services** 




  





 Shape your Business-IT consulting career at an exceptional company:
 **Tata Consultancy Services (TCS).** 




  





 As a strategic partner with more than 600,000 experts, we help customers achieve their business goals and lead digital transformations to the finish line. Our expertise and services span industries such as Financial Services, Manufacturing, Retail, Communications, Travel, Healthcare, Utilities and Public Sector. TCS has been present in the Nordic region since 1991 and currently has over 20,000 employees supporting leading enterprises in the Nordics drive growth and transformation. Our customers include some of the largest companies in Sweden and in the Nordics. TCS has been named a Top Employer by the Top Employers Institute in Sweden, Finland, Norway and Denmark.
 



  





 TCS has consistently received top customer satisfaction rankings for 14 years in a row in an independent customer survey. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.
 



 The Client Partner would be responsible for leading and managing the customer relationship across all levels, growing the business, and delivering exceptional value to all stakeholders involved.
 



  





**Role: Client Partner** 




**Location: Stockholm, Sweden** 




**Start Date: Immediately** 




  





**Your Responsibilities** 




  





**Relationship Management:** 




 - Cultivate and maintain client relationships at all levels.
 



 - Ensure the highest levels of client satisfaction are achieved according to set targets.
 



 - Monitor, assess, and evaluate engagements, proposing key improvements to CXO-level stakeholders.
 



 - Lead key governance meetings at strategic and tactical levels.
 



  





**Business Growth:** 




 - Lead the entire sales process for the account, from deal identification to guiding the customer and TCS team through the deal lifecycle.
 



 - Lead development of compelling business solutions tailored for client needs and win new business at clients.
 



 - Create an account plan and sales strategy that ensures the attainment of the company’s revenue and pipeline targets.
 



  





**Delivery and Team Management:** 




 - Ensure services are delivered smoothly to clients, managing targets and delivering on-time and on-budget.
 



 - Lead and manage the account team in a global delivery model.
 



 - Focus on continual improvements across all KPIs of the account relationship.
 



 - Travel as required by business needs.
 



  





**Your Qualifications** 




 - Possess a CXO-level presence and gravitas, demonstrating the ability to engage effectively with CXOs on strategic topics in a purposeful and credible manner.
 



 - Proven hands-on experience in delivering customer-centric solutions, including large-scale projects and managed services covering applications, infrastructure, IT security, and business process services. Deep understanding of Agile methodologies.
 



 - Established track record of nurturing and expanding client relationships into strategic partnerships with significant business impact.
 



 - Capability to lead and win large deals, combined with a robust C-level network. Adept at identifying client needs and proposing appropriate solutions and offerings from TCS.
 



 - Proficient in managing account financials.
 



 - Experience in working within a global, multicultural firm environment.
 



 - A minimum of 15 years of experience in the IT industry.
 



 - Bachelor’s degree or higher qualification.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via
 **r.naveen2@tcs.com** 




  





 https://www.tcs.com/careers/sweden
 



  





 Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice

title: Sales Executive - Cyber
description:
Integrity360 is the largest independent cybersecurity provider in UK & Ireland, with Security Operations Centers in Dublin, Sofia and South Africa, and with around 580 employees, of which over 80% are technical. We help our clients proactively identify, protect, detect and respond to threats against the ever-evolving cyber threat landscape.
   

  

 Our ‘Security First’ approach positions security as an enabler and empowers our clients to do business securely. In tandem with this is the requirement for our clients to manage cyber risk and compliance appropriately and proportionately in order to demonstrate effective corporate governance over their cyber estate, and that it is aligned to strategic business objectives.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are looking for an Sales Executive who has experience selling cyber security solutions and managed services to Clients. The ideal candidate should be energetic, motivated, and persistent with strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build trust and must be someone who demonstrates deep customer expertise and empathy, who is committed to achieving brilliant experiences for our customers
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Pro-active new business development.
* Cold calling customers in order to promote and sell our Managed Services portfolio.
* Cold calling customers with regards to their Cyber Security and offering new technologies, renewing their current solutions or alternative solutions to meet their needs
* Achieving personal targets of sales and gross contribution.
* Creating proposal and quotation documents.
* Competing with other Partners in a competitive market and ensuring that our products and professional services were an attractive option.
* Provide outstanding services and ensure customer satisfaction.
* Develop and manage pipeline, providing weekly updates to forecast.
* Field Sales - attended client meetings,
* Build and maintain relationships with Vendors
* Promote the Integrity360 ‘brand’ by exceeding customer expectation and ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction in the sales experience


**Required Experience**
* 2+ years cyber sales experience
* Proposal writing experience
* Experience of working in a target driven environment
* Proven track record in new business sales


**Required Skills**
* Resilience – ability to stay focussed on job-in-hand/stay determined.
* Listening – ability to detect potential problems proactively
* Ability to engage and influence others.
* Negotiation Skills – securing win-win agreements.
* Observation Skills – recognising objectively what is happening in or across the organisation and applying solutions to a given problem that ‘fits’
* A positive, enthusiastic, and focused approach with a strong determination for success
* Ability to influence at all levels.
* Excellent Communication skills

title: Solution Advisor Senior Specialist
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**We help the world run better**
 At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.
   

  

 The
 **HCM Sr Solution Advisor Specialist** 
 brings well-developed solution and business process knowledge to customers by demonstrating a compelling vision of the future with SAP SuccessFactors/HCM partner solutions. The ideal candidate will have strong presentation skills, deep knowledge of SuccessFactors portfolio, and the ability to engage with stakeholders at all levels. The individual will act as a subject matter expert on SuccessFactors, staying current on product updates, new features, and industry trends.
   

  

**Account Team Engagement**
* Engage with customers early in the sales cycle by matching customer needs and vision to SAP SuccessFactors solutions and qualifying the opportunity against a probability of success.
* Manage the business process discovery to provide a foundation for the solution recommendations and support the business capability mapping, technical discoveries, and the case for change.
* Support new sales and adoption by providing solution-specific expertise and competitive differentiation.
* Provide expertise to the account team and to the development of the account strategy.
* Contribute to creation of overall theme and competitive differentiation (value wedges) and execute dry runs.
* Engage customers through impactful storytelling.
* Provide answers to customer / internal SAP team inquiries concerning solution topics focusing on driving customer success and business outcomes.
* Embrace consistent messaging and employ digital assets in all customer engagements, including recorded demos, presentations, microsites, and other reusable content.


**Customer Lifecycle Engagement**
* Effectively transition the deal to on-boarding teams / partner / Field Services.
* Drive adoption by continuing to sell the vision and impact of SAP's solutions post-selection.
* Provide expertise through the customers' successful deployments and realization of value, as required.


**Bring out your best**
 SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
   

  

**We win with inclusion**
 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
   

  

 SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com
   

  

 For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
   

  

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability**
 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
   

  

 Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
   

  

 Requisition ID: 425062 | Work Area: Presales | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: .

title: Front Office Ambassador At Six - Full Time
description:
**The Magic Starts At Six**
 At Six is a contemporary art and design hotel with 343 rooms and suites, including our Masterpiece Suite and 32 longstay apartments adjacent to the hotel. In the house you will also find - the wine bar Blanche & Hierta, At Six Cocktailbar and the large international restaurant Dining Room. There is also a gym, wellness and 3000m2 flexible event and meeting space. At Six is run by Petter Stordalen's hotel group Nordic Hotels & Resorts, together with the neighboring hotel Hobo, The Thief, Copperhill, Yasuragi, Villa Copenhagen, Sommerro, Kämp hotels and the American Line.
   

  

 Since its inception in 2017, Hotel At Six is striving to redefine and explore the meaning of luxury in a contemporary context. Today, we’re one of the leading choices for high-end travelers in Scandinavia. Our employees pride themselves in delivering products and services on an international standard, in a warm and friendly work environment.
   

  

**Do you have what it takes to deliver a great first and last impression for our guests?**
 Our Front Office Team is made up of bright and self-standing individuals who strive every day to deliver a true At Six Experience, 24/7, 365 days per year. We take pride in welcoming our guests and assisting them with all types of requests; from check in to check out and everything that stands in between. We particularly like challenging situations, love troubleshooting and delivering the At Six wow factor. Our mission is to redefine service at the Front Desk and be the benchmark department in terms of service for Stockholm and Sweden, you name it!
   

  

 Our Front Office Team operates around the clock and takes care of both our in-house guests as well as guests staying in our At Six residences.
   

  

 This is a permanent role which includes a 6 months probation period. The successful candidate will be working 40hrs a week and is expected to be able to work a variety of shifts including mornings, afternoons and weekends as well as Holidays.
   

  

**The Role and Our Philosophy**
 As Front Office Ambassador you are responsible for smooth running of the department during the day, supporting our Front Office Team with a variety of tasks, check in check out, taking care of our guests email inbox. The latter will connect you to a variety of responsibilities and tasks, which are linked to all the other departments within the hotel. This is a position that comes with great responsibility and flexibility as your main focus will be given to Front Office related tasks and a number of other duties which are connected to the whole Hotel operations.
   

  

 Our philosophy is that every detail makes a difference, and the differences make all the details.
   

  

**And what about you?**
 You have worked in either Front Office or Reservation and have at least 1 year experience using a well-known PMS platform (Cenium, Opera, Fidelio, Mews). Full command of both Swedish and English is needed. Driving License is desirable. In addition to the following, you should enjoy working in a fast paced environment and have preferably some experience working within the luxury segment of our industry.
   

  

 A go-get attitude will take you a long way, ability to work in an international team and environment is needed to succeed in the role. A positive mindset and having fun at work is a must!
   

  

 To recap, do you have all of the below skills?
   

  

* Previous experience within Front Office or Reservation Departments
* Previous experience working with the luxury segment
* Fluent in both Swedish and English
* Good knowledge of any well-known PMS platform
* Ability to work a variety of shifts including mornings, afternoons and weekends as well as Holidays


**Join us!**
 There! With all the mandatory stuff out of the way, let’s talk. Face to face, preferably. Apply below and don’t hesitate to send our Rooms Division Manager, Stefano Paganelli an email at stefano.paganelli@hotelatsix.com if you have any questions.
   

  

 Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis and the position can be filled before the last application date. So—what are you waiting for? Apply now!

title: IT Architect - Hydro Assets
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 Vattenfall is recognized as one of the first movers in the energy transition – and by that power climate smarter living for all our customers.
   

  

 Yet, our investment power, innovation, and ambitious change agenda to become fossil free in one generation, can only be met if our energy production assets are ready to deal with this electrification revolution. To face this challenge we invest in our people and we continue to employ exceptional IT talent. With our team, we are advancing  the Hydro business area in Vattenfall as a data driven company allowing them to optimize decision making and investment planning.
   

  

 Business unit Hydro Nordic is responsible for Vattenfall’s 90 hydropower plants and 400 dams in the Nordic region. Hydro’s renewable electricity generation is a prerequisite for a climate-smart and fossil-free society, and a sustainable energy system
   

  

 Together with them, you will be architecting:
   

  

* Full IT/OT convergence to ensure frictionless transfer of data (near) real time
* Supporting on our Next Gen ERP transformation
* Data Driven solutions (Predictive maintenance, Digital Twins, AI cases)
* Work on new market models (ancillary services),
* Bring Hydro to the next level by Modernisation of IT architecture
* Advanced solutions to deliver real-time insights into the performance of our Hydro assets to lower maintenance costs


 Our Group IT Architecture team of 30 enterprise / solution architects is involved in around 100+ key projects at any time, focusing on enterprise architecture and solution architecture for all Vattenfall business units. We act as the hub to understand business needs and to see the bigger Vattenfall picture to help our teams securely adopt the technologies of tomorrow.
   

  

**Your main responsibilities:**
* You will join the larger strategic projects, to guide them into successful execution based on fit-for-purpose architecture
* You will consult and educate the Hydro business on IT strategy, integration strategy, data strategy etc
* You have a solid understanding of IT security and will support Hydro in fit-for-purpose adoption.
* You will have (or build up) Hydro domain knowledge to become the go-to point how Hydro should advance its IT landscape.
* You will, in dialogue with business, drive a further adoption of data mesh
* You will help us grow our Enterprise thinking and establish standards and architecture principles. You will be our trusted advisor towards our Hydro and other business area’s to enable their operating model by technology – also if that is that means radical change!


 Din bakgrund
   

  

 We are looking for a generic and allround Architect, with experience preferably as Architect or Consultant in an asset intense industry (Energy, Water, Industry, Automotive or alike). Some experience with integration topics is an advantage.
   

  

 Our team requires true Business facing Solution architects; You know how to use technology to make our Hydro assets run as clockwork, you act as timer to ensure we meet our ambitious goals and be an alarm if we can do better! We have a large SAP and Microsoft footprint, with more than 20.000 users in six countries
   

  

 You feel comfortable communicating with both IT and non-IT colleagues on different levels in the organization. You enjoy being in an ever-changing environment. Furthermore you:
   

  

* Have an academic degree in IT or related study
* Have worked in an international environment and you speak Swedish and English
* Have deep IT knowledge and experience with IT architecture and frameworks
* Ideally bring experience from an asset intensive industry
* Have experience with Microsoft Azure Well Architected Framework
* You enjoy producing enterprise ready architecture documents
* And you have the skills to direct complex problems into concise Management Board action
* And… we love architects who talk business and know TOGAF, rather than those that talk TOGAF and know business …


**Location:** 
 for this position you will be based in Lulea, Sweden, with some occasional travelling to Hydro locations in Sweden and Vattenfall IT team events. (Stockholm, Solna).
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

**Our Offer**
* Become part of a massive transformative purpose – not on paper, but in real-life – whereby you can influence the outcome!
* We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field.
* You will work in an interdisciplinary team with other senior IT Architects – so we do this together!
* A professional environment where your experience, knowledge and attitude will bring us one step further and the opportunity for you to grow further.
* A central office location with easy access by public transport.
* Furthermore, a healthy work-life balance (smart working) and time to develop your profession
* At Vattenfall you get the opportunity to work for a clean energy company that aims for creating fossil free energy within one generation.
* And last but not least; International and multi-cultural work environment with energetic, motivated colleagues that like to have fun as well!


  

  

**More information**
 We welcome your application in English via our website. For information about the position, please contact recruiting manager Emile Das (NL), +31 6 5250 4359 or Rikard Haapala, +46702595746. For more information about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact Recruiter Folmer Koper +31 6 38710915.
   

  

 At Vattenfall, we are convinced that striving for diversity helps building a more profitable, efficient and attractive company. We continue to seek a harmonious balance of employees in terms of gender, age, ethnic and cultural backgrounds.
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible within one generation and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.

title: Director, NetCo & Support Functions Business Controlling Sweden
description:
**Director, Business Finance – Lead Our Nordic Team Supporting NetCo & Support Functions**
*Do you want to lead a skilled finance team working at the core of Nordic infrastructure investments?*
 We are looking for a
 **Director, NetCo & Support Functions** 
 who not only brings strong financial expertise, but also a clear focus on
 **people leadership** 
 and experience managing finance teams across borders. You will lead, develop, motivate, and unite a Nordic team of 6 Business Controllers – based in Denmark, Sweden, and Norway.
   

  

 Together, you contribute financial insight and transparency across a wide area of our business. NetCo itself is a central part of GlobalConnect, with around 500 employees and over €100 million in digital infrastructure investments annually. It includes both commercial activities - like infrastructure capacity and data center services for international and national carriers - and responsibility for developing and maintaining Group IT and the technology backbone for the entire organization.
   

  

 The role is placed within the
 *Business Finance* 
 organization and is responsible for business controlling and partnering in close collaboration with stakeholders across Sales, Technology, IT, and Staff functions. You’ll oversee controlling and budgeting/forecasting of revenue, EBITDA, and capex – with capex being a key focus area. Knowledge of accounting practices is important, as the team works closely with Accounting on processes such as monthly closing.
   

  

 You’ll build a motivated team culture across borders, offer clear guidance, and support each team member in delivering high-quality financial insights. Through structured collaboration and open communication, you’ll help ensure consistency, efficiency, and engagement across the Nordic region.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities:**
* Lead and support a Nordic team of 6 Business Controllers based in Denmark, Sweden, and Norway.
* Foster team collaboration and professional development across borders.
* Take responsibility for controlling, budgeting, and forecasting across revenue, EBITDA, and capex.
* Support investment cases, CAPEX planning, and financial modelling for NetCo and Support Functions.
* Collaborate closely with Accounting on monthly close and financial accuracy.


**To guide this journey, we believe you bring:**
* Experience from a financial leadership role at Director level, preferably across multiple countries.
* Deep knowledge of CAPEX controlling, investment analysis, and financial forecasting.
* Thrives in an international and dynamic organization with high complexity.
* An experienced business partnering mindset and delivers value through insight and analysis.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to lead and inspire from a distance.
* Fluency in verbal and written English.


**We offer you:**
* A key leadership role with high visibility and influence in a growing company.
* A skilled, dedicated, and international team with a profound expertise.
* A working environment built on trust, well-being, and professional development.
* Flexible location in one of our Nordic offices – regular travel is to be expected.
* Great opportunities to shape processes and collaboration in a fast-paced environment.


**Why join GlobalConnect and the Business Finance team?**
 This is a unique opportunity to shape the financial direction of our digital infrastructure business and support functions. You’ll join a skilled, collaborative finance team with high visibility and real impact. We offer flexibility, trust, and room to grow - both as a professional and as a leader.
   

  

 GlobalConnect is on a growth journey, building the digital backbone of the Nordics. In this role, you’ll be close to decisions that matter and help ensure that we invest wisely, operate efficiently, and build sustainably.
   

  

*No need to submit a personal letter unless there’s something specific you want to highlight that’s not already in your CV or LinkedIn profile.*
 Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Integrationsarkitekt
description:
*Redpill Linpro är ledande specialister inom open source och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle. Tillsammans samverkar vi för att uppnå maximal nytta för alla. Hos oss finns några av marknadens främsta experter inom sina specialområden. Vi är omkring 320 anställda och du finner oss i tre länder på åtta kontor: Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlstad, Linköping samt i Köpenhamn, Århus. Oslo och Trondheim.*
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Vi har mer än 10 års erfarenhet från integrationsområdet och är idag stora partners till MuleSoft, WSO2 och RedHat. Vi har flera utbildade och certifierade konsulter i området och nu förstärker vi vårt team ytterligare. Vi söker dig som, liksom vi, brinner för att leverera lösningar som bygger på öppen källkod. Till denna tjänst söker vi både dig med lång erfarenhet av integration och dig som är ny men nyfiken på området.
   

  

 Som integrationsutvecklare är din huvudsakliga uppgift att utveckla plattformar som möjliggör integrationen av olika system att jobba sömlöst tillsammans.
   

  

**I det dagliga arbetet kommer du att:**
* Utveckla API:er och integrationer med teknologier som REST, GraphQL, Kafka, Camel, MQTT, RAML och OpenAPI
* Ha tät dialog med kund, teamet och användare för att designa och implementera de bästa tekniska lösningarna
* Stötta kunder med utvecklingen av deras integrationsplattform och löpande säkerställa prestanda och tillgänglighet på applikationslösningarna


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas som konsult hos oss är det viktigt att du har ett stort teknikintresse och en vilja att utvecklas inom nya områden och i ny teknik. Du drivs av problemlösning och förstår att det är samarbete som för oss framåt.
   

  

**Utöver ovanstående kompetenser ser vi att du har:**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning i datateknik eller relaterat område
* Erfarenhet av API-baserade integrationer och datatransformering
* Kunskap i Java
* Van att arbeta i agila team, gärna i en DevOps-setting
* Mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska


**Meriter:**
* Erfarenhet och/eller certifiering i Mulesoft Anypoint Platform, WSO2 eller annan ledande integrationsplattform
* Erfarenhet av att kommunicera direkt med verksamhetsansvariga beställare och kunder
* Erfarenhet inom cloud, säkerhet, IAM och mikrotjänstearkitektur


**Varför Redpill Linpro?**
* Du får arbeta med några av de allra mest begåvade IT-talangerna i en organisation som brinner för professionella Open Source-ideal
* Du får arbeta med spännande projekt i flera olika branscher: allt från startups till globala jättar och myndigheter där du får vara med och göra skillnad på riktigt!
* Du får trevliga chefer som för en bra personalpolitik - våra konsulter är våra superstars och prioriteras alltid först
* Du får arbeta med den senaste tech-stacken och alltid vara up-to-date med ny teknologi
* Du får ta del av fördelarna att arbeta på ett medelstort nordiskt bolag med go sammanhållning, bra förmåner och där du ges stor frihet och flexibilitet i ditt arbete


 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du vill arbeta med oss. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in Oslo, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Karlstad Linköping, Copenhagen, Aarhus, and Trondheim with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Product Manager - Capacity & Conversion
description:
**About Us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Product Manager on our Capacity & Conversion team, you'll be at the heart of our logistics engine, driving innovation in capacity management and e-commerce conversion optimization. You'll leverage the power of data and algorithms to impact the delivery experience of millions of people every year. We're looking for a creative problem-solver who can lead and collaborate with a team of highly skilled engineers and data scientists to develop and deploy these solutions. You'll naturally be data-driven and thrive on making a significant impact.
   

  

**The problem space**
 The Capacity & Conversion team is responsible for all predictions for consumers about the expected day/time of delivery. These ETAs guide consumers to select us in ecommerce checkouts, knowing when they can expect to receive their parcel. The prediction engine also guides what information is presented to consumers and guides sorting and routing decisions to ensure that consumer promise is kept. Thus this team has a major responsibility in delivering a great consumer experience. But also owns the commercial challenge of optimising when Instabee is selected in checkouts vs our competitors.
   

  

**The team**
 You will be working with a highly skilled team of software engineers, machine learning experts and data scientists, supported by an Engineering Manager and Staff Engineer. This team has generated several pending patents.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Define the vision, strategy, and roadmap for the problem area.
* Drive data-informed decisions, working with analytics to optimize and innovate.
* Continue to innovate in a ground-breaking way to redefine the shipping experience.
* Optimize the accuracy of our predictions and our checkout conversion
* Collaborate with stakeholders, from other product managers to C-level, to align on goals and execution.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Bsc in Computer Science, Engineering Physics, Information Systems, Applied Mathematics, Mechanical Engineering or similar from top university
* 4-5yrs experience in engineering or data scientist or analytics or machine learning role as part of professional engineering team
* Applied maths/stats knowledge and basic machine learning knowledge
* Proficient English
* A data-driven mindset with the ability to analyze and act on insights independently or with analytics.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills, comfortable working with diverse stakeholders.


***Beneficial For The Role***
* Experience with A/B testing
* Know SQL or willing to learn


**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
   

  

 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
   

  

 🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.
   

  

 👾 Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.
   

  

 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
   

  

 ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
   

  

 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
   

  

 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion are very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

***"By the way, we will start looking at applications end February 2025.
   

  

 Looking forward hearing from you!"***
*This recruitment process consists of personality tests via Alva Labs and background checks as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes in Sweden.*
 Instabee was founded in 2022 after combining Budbee and Instabox — two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee is present in six countries, serving thousands of online merchants, including ASOS, Zalando, Inditex and H&M and is on track to become the most admired European e-commerce enabler.
   

  

 Since the start, Instabee has focused on consumer-centric and sustainable solutions, offering deliveries to boxes and homes using muscle power, electricity, renewable diesel and biofuels. Through bespoke technical solutions, Instabee can guarantee optimal fill rates and routing, minimising any unnecessary transports. Instabee is backed by Kinnevik, Creades and EQT, among others.

title: Controller Group Functions & Innovation Capex
company_industry: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education
description:
*Karo Healthcare, a dynamic and growing personal-care retail company, is all about making smart choices for everyday healthcare. With a wide-ranging portfolio across seven categories including medical products, we own and sell over 80 brands in about 90 countries. Our portfolio includes such brands as E45, Pevaryl, Lamisil, Nutravita, Decubal and many others. Our core belief in empowering people to make intelligent health decisions drives our growth strategy, blending organic expansion and M&A.*



**What's in it for you?**

 At Karo, you'll step into a truly international role where finance meets strategy and innovation.
   

 You'll work across borders and functions, influencing investment decisions and supporting high-impact projects in a rapidly growing company. Expect strong exposure to senior stakeholders, a hands-on environment where your ideas matter, and the chance to shape scalable processes in a dynamic, evolving finance team.
 



 This is a great fit if you're looking to:
 


* Accelerate your finance career in an international FMCG-style environment
* Take ownership, grow quickly, and make a real impact
* Be part of a purpose-driven company with ambitious growth goals
  


**What you'll be doing**

 As our
 **Controller - Group Functions & Innovation CAPEX** 
 , you'll partner closely with our Group Functions and Innovation teams, becoming their go-to person for all things Opex and Capex.
   

 This is not just a reporting role—it's about owning processes, driving insights, and supporting decision-making at scale.
 



 Key responsibilities:
 


* **Control & Track Spend** 
 : Lead financial planning and monitoring of Opex (Group Functions) and Capex (Group-wide Innovation), ensuring accurate tracking and alignment with budget
* **Drive Reporting Excellence** 
 : Deliver timely and accurate financial reports, with a focus on clarity, compliance, and insight
* **Enable Better Forecasting** 
 : Own budgeting and forecasting cycles, providing data-driven input and analysis
* **Boost Collaboration** 
 : Act as a business partner to cross-functional stakeholders—including Finance, Digital, Innovation, and more
* **Spot and Solve** 
 : Use data to uncover trends, cost-saving opportunities, and process improvements
* **Support Compliance** 
 : Ensure financial controls are in place and adhered to, supporting our growth with governance



  
   

  




**Requirements**

 We're looking for someone proactive, hands-on, and eager to grow—someone who thrives in fast-paced, constantly evolving environments and who brings both financial acumen and business curiosity.
   





 You'll likely bring:
 


* A degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or a related field
* 2-5 years' experience in a finance or controlling role (ideally in FMCG, pharma, or other fast-moving industries)
* Advanced Excel skills and comfort working with financial systems
* A structured mindset with strong analytical skills and attention to detail
* Great communication skills—you'll be liaising with both finance and non-finance teams
* A positive, collaborative mindset and the ability to juggle multiple priorities
* A self-starter attitude—willing to take ownership, ask questions, and push things forward
  

  


**Benefits**
* Opportunity to create, grow, and encourage
* Apart from a competitive salary pack, there are lots of growth opportunities to meet your personal ambitions
* Flexible schedule, hybrid model with the primary work place in the office, and life-work balance
* Responsibility for exciting and challenging projects that have a direct, visible impact on our customers and the industry
* Very positive work environment in a dynamic, international, and motivated team
* Start-up spirit while being a part of the large international organization with strong values



  
 



   
 



*Karo Healthcare has a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We are looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion, national origin, disability or age.*

title: Systemförvaltare med fokus på SimCorp Dimension till AP7
description:
*Vill du vara med och vidareutveckla ett av marknadens mest kraftfulla system för kapitalförvaltning? Har du erfarenhet av SimCorp Dimension och ett intresse för både teknik och verksamhetsutveckling? Då kan detta vara en spännande möjlighet för dig!*
 På AP7 präglas arbetet av självledarskap, samarbete och en generös kultur där kunskapsdelning är en naturlig del av vardagen. IT-enheten ansvarar för allt från systemförvaltning och datahantering till verksamhetsutveckling, drift och användarsupport. Nu söker vi en kvalificerad och affärsnära systemförvaltare med särskilt fokus på SimCorp Dimension. I denna spännande roll får du ett utökat ansvar för att aktivt förstå och utveckla kapitalförvaltningsavdelningens behov, samt bidra till att optimera och stödja deras verksamhet.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I rollen som systemförvaltare får du ett helhetsansvar för att förvalta och utveckla SimCorp Dimension – ett affärskritiskt system inom kapitalförvaltningen. Arbetet innebär både tekniska uppgifter och nära dialog med verksamheten. Du kommer att arbeta med att förbättra funktionalitet, effektivisera processer och ge användarstöd i det dagliga arbetet. Du ingår i ett IT-team på sex personer, inklusive chef, där samarbete och erfarenhetsutbyte är en naturlig del av vardagen.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter innebär att du:
   

  

* Ansvara för att konfigurera och optimera SimCorp Dimension för att stödja verksamhetens behov och säkerställa stabil drift.
* Fungera som användarstöd för verksamheten och delta i problemlösning kring system och processer.
* Leda implementering av ny funktionalitet, nya moduler eller integrationer.
* Delta i och ibland driva projekt och utredningar för att förbättra kapitalförvaltningens och andra avdelningars processer.
* Bygga nära relationer med användarna för att förstå och omvandla deras behov till systemlösningar.
* Samverka med övriga delar av organisationen för att säkerställa att leveranserna motsvarar verksamhetens krav.


**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har erfarenhet av en liknande roll inom systemförvaltning
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i SimCorp Dimension
* Är van att arbeta med systemkonfiguration och parametersättning.
* Har god teknisk förståelse och insikt i hur omgivande system interagerar med SimCorp Dimension.
* Har god förståelse för finansiella instrument och kapitalförvaltningsprocesser


 För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du är kommunikativ, har lätt för att samarbeta och är flexibel i ditt arbetssätt. Du tar gärna egna initiativ och har ett öga för att hitta nya lösningar eller förbättringsmöjligheter.
   

  

**Om AP7**
 AP7 är ett statligt bolag inom finansbranschen som förvaltar det statliga alternativet i premiepensionen. Deras kontor är beläget centralt i Stockholm, där AP7 erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö med möjlighet till flexibelt distansarbete. AP7 värdesätter mångfald och inkludering och strävar efter att skapa en arbetsplats där alla känner sig välkomna och uppskattade.
   

  

**AP7 erbjuder:**
* Möjlighet att påverka och vidareutveckla hur vi arbetar med SimCorp Dimension.
* En dynamisk och lärande miljö där kunskapsdelning och samarbete står i fokus.
* Ett långsiktigt och meningsfullt uppdrag att leverera god premiepension till alla våra 5,5 miljoner sparare
* En central roll i en organisation där IT är en möjliggörare för affären.
* Möjlighet till flexibelt arbete för att underlätta balans mellan arbete och privatliv.
* En dynamisk och omväxlande arbetsmiljö.
* Stödjande och inkluderande arbetskultur med fokus på personlig och professionell utveckling.


**Frågor och kontakt**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar AP7 med Amendo Tech. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Om Amendo Tech**
 Amendo Tech är det självklara konsult- och rekryteringsföretaget inom tech, IT och digital utveckling.
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med kompetensförsörjning sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Lagotto Executive Search & Interim som är specialiserade på executive search och interima tillsättningar av ledare och specialister, samt Amendo Bemanning och Rekrytering som erbjuder rekryterings- och konsultlösningar inom ekonomi, bank, finans, försäkring, HR och kommunikation.
   

  

 Följ gärna Amendo Tech på Linkedin.
   

  

 #IT

title: Property Underwriter
description:
**Looking for a New Challenge? Become Our Next Property Underwriter in Sweden!**
 In Sweden, we are looking to expand with a
 **Property Underwriter** 
 , who has a keen interest in sales, and wants to grow our portfolio of insurances, especially focusing on our commercial property products in selected client and industry segments.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 The RiskPoint Group is a global Managing General Underwriter (MGU) that offers best-in-class insurance solutions backed by the insurance companies we represent.
   

  

 We are an agile company with strong cross-border collaboration, leveraging our extensive, international expertise.
   

  

 Our company structure is flat, and we provide great opportunities for every employee to make a difference, take responsibility, enhance their skill set, and grow.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Based in Stockholm, you will become part of our growing local office, currently consisting of 27 individuals working across multiple lines of business. The Property team is part of our Property & Construction department, which comprises 14 experts across the Nordic countries. Each team member specializes in their respective field of insurance.
   

  

 Our headquarters in Copenhagen serves as the hub of our Nordic operations, supported by dedicated teams in Sweden and Norway who provide local insights and services, enabling us to meet the specific demands of clients throughout the region.
   

  

 We have built a strong position in the Nordic market and continue to expand in commercial property.
   

  

**About The Position**
 As our new Property Underwriter, you will be a vital player in driving sales for our Commercial Property portfolio in Sweden and have the opportunity to influence changes in a fast-growing, ever-changing business environment and insurance marketplace.
