 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/3190 | Kontakt: Martin Björck 070-7374058, | Facklig företrädare: Jonas Ivarsson, SACO 08-12314458, Tommy Mäntynen, Vision tommy.mantynen@regionstockholm.se, Thérèse Juvall, Akademikerförbundet SSR 08-12313942, | Publicerat: 2025-05-02 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-25

title: Data engineer AI-team
description:
Vi söker dig, vår nya Data engineer som brinner för att identifiera, utvärdera och säkerställa tillgång till relevanta datakällor för AI-initiativ och projekt. Vill du bli den viktiga länken mellan vårt nybildade AI-team och verksamheten i datarelaterade frågor, och bidra till att forma framtidens datadrivna lösningar? Då kan detta uppdrag vara rätt för dig!
   

  

**Om oss**
 Region Stockholm är ledande inom life science, forskning och innovation i Sverige. Life science spelar en avgörande roll i utvecklingen av nya medicinska behandlingar och bioteknologiska innovationer, vilket bidrar till förbättrad hälsa och livskvalitet. Forskningen fokuserar främst på att förbättra vården och livskvaliteten för invånarna, samt att göra verksamheter mer hållbara. Innovationsprojekt syftar till att utveckla nya produkter och tjänster inom hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik och regional planering i syfte att förenkla och förbättra patientvården och andra tjänster för regionens invånare.
   

  

 Arbetet för att stärka Region Stockholms förmåga till en ansvarsfull användning av AI inom life science, forskning och innovation fortsätter under 2025 genom inrättandet av ett regionalt AI-team, ett team med utvecklingskompetens inom AI som ska arbeta med AI-initiativ inom hälsovård, trafik, kultur och regional utveckling. Initiativet ska stärka den egna kompetensen inom egenutveckling och upphandling av AI både centralt och lokalt inom regionen.
   

  

 AI-teamet tillhör avdelningen Strategisk IT på regionledningskontoret, vars uppdrag är att styra, utveckla, följa upp och samordna it, digitalisering och informationssäkerhet på strategisk nivå för hela Region Stockholm. Ett arbete som bedrivs i nära dialog och samarbete med förvaltningar och bolag.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som Data engineer blir du en viktig länk mellan teamet och verksamheten i datarelaterade frågor och medverkar i uppbyggnaden av teamet. Du ansvarar för att identifiera, utvärdera och säkerställa tillgång till relevanta datakällor för olika AI-initiativ och projekt inom region Stockholm. I uppdraget ingår även ett operativt ansvar för datamigrering mellan system som skapar förutsättningar för robusta data pipelines och du säkerställer att data pipelines effektivt kan interagera med verksamhetssystem och datalagring. Dessutom ansvarar du för att datahanterings- och integrationsprocesser följer offentlig sektors regelverk, inklusive GDPR.
   

  

 I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår exempelvis att:
   

  

* I AI-projektens uppstartsfas arbeta tillsammans med verksamheternas representanter för att säkerställa tillgång till relevant data
* Designa och utveckla data pipelines för att stödja AI-applikationer.
* Hantera och optimera ETL/ELT-processer.
* Samarbeta med AI-ingenjörer och data scientists för att säkerställa högkvalitativa data för modellträning.
* Utföra datarensning och förberedelse för att säkerställa hög datakvalitet.
* Säkerställa att datahantering följer lagar och regler som gäller för offentlig sektor, inklusive GDPR.
* Hålla sig uppdaterad med de senaste forskningsrönen och integrera nya tekniker i projekten.


**Vem är du?**
 Som person är du uthållig, vetgirig och pedagogiskt skicklig och du strävar efter att förstå och utveckla verksamheten. Du motiveras av att upptäcka och undersöka relevanta datakällor. Du har ett väl utvecklat analytiskt tänkande och en god problemlösningsförmåga. Du är dessutom en utmärkt kommunikatör med en god samarbetsförmåga som har förmågan att arbeta självständigt och ta egna initiativ. Du har även en förståelse och ett engagemang för offentlig verksamhets värderingar och målsättningar.
   

  

 För att bli framgångsrik i rollen har du:
   

  

* Relevant akademisk utbildning inom data, IT eller systemvetenskap, alternativt motsvarande praktisk erfarenhet
* Minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av datahantering, ETL/ELT-processer
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom området data engineering eller inom ett annat relevant område för uppdraget
* God erfarenhet av att arbeta med strukturerade, semistrukturerade och ostrukturerade data
* Goda programmeringskunskaper i Python och SQL
* Erfarenhet av molnbaserade dataplattformar (AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud)
* Praktisk erfarenhet av databashantering och automatiserade dataflöden
* Kunskap om IT-säkerhet, dataskydd och GDPR inom offentlig sektor
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och kommunicera tekniska koncept till icke-tekniska kollegor
* God kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt
* Analytisk förmåga och strukturerat arbetssätt


 Det är meriterande om du även har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av databasmodellering och metodologier som Kimball
* Kunskaper inom DevOps (CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes)
* Erfarenhet av realtidsdataflöden och prestandaoptimering
* Erfarenhet av big data-teknologier som Hadoop, Spark eller Kafka
* Praktisk erfarenhet av Microsoft SQL Server och Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services
* Tidigare arbete med AI-projekt och datahantering för AI-modeller inom offentlig sektor
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila team
* Förmåga att förklara tekniska koncept för icke-tekniska intressenter
* Förståelse för hur offentlig verksamhet fungerar och erfarenhet av att arbeta i en politiskt styrd organisation
* Erfarenhet av hälso- och sjukvårdsverksamhet.


**Rekryteringsprocessen**
 I vår rekryteringsprocess använder vi oss av Assessios test MAP och Matrigma. MAP är ett
   

  

 personlighetstest och Matrigma är ett icke-verbalt begåvningstest som båda bygger på arbetspsykologisk forskning. Testerna används som ett komplement till dina erfarenheter och kompetenser och syftet är att göra vår urvalsprocess kvalitetssäker och transparent.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Vi erbjuder dig ett stimulerande uppdrag där du får vara med och bygga upp arbetet med AI från grunden inom Region Stockholm. Du får möjlighet att vara med och forma och påverka framtiden med hjälp av AI, i ett uppstartsläge där allt fortfarande är under utveckling och ligger framför oss. Du kommer att arbeta i en dynamisk arbetsmiljö och ingå i ett inspirerande team med drivna och pedagogiska kollegor som delar din passion för AI, utveckling och moderna tekniker.
   

  

 Uppdraget är en projektanställning till och med 31 december 2028.
   

  

 Vi har kollektivavtal och med det följer kollektivavtalade försäkringar, tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdstimme och friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård i form av kostnadsfri öppensjukvård. Flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån har vi för att underlätta för dig att få ihop vardagen. Här kan du läsa mer om förmånerna i vårt kollektivavtal.
   

  

 Vi utgår från fina lokaler på Lindhagensgatan 98 men vi vill att du arbetar när den verksamhet där utvecklingsprojektet sker, vilket innebär att du måste räkna med att du behöver arbeta ute på regionens olika enheter under enstaka eller några dagar i veckan.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som något för dig ser vi gärna att du söker så snart som möjligt. För en komplett ansökan räcker det med att bifoga ditt CV. När du ansöker kommer du att få besvara ett antal frågor, dessa ersätter personligt brev.
   

  

 Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Martin Björck, martin.bjorck@regionstockholm.se.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Regionledningskontoret stödjer regionstyrelsen i uppgiften att leda, styra, samordna och följa upp Region Stockholms verksamheter. Förvaltningen arbetar strategiskt och operativt utifrån ett koncernperspektiv och ger regionstyrelsen de underlag och det stöd den behöver i sitt uppdrag att utveckla Region Stockholm. Regionledningskontoret ansvarar även för stöd till klimat- och regionutvecklingsnämnden samt för verksamhetsstödjande tjänster inom koncernen. Läs mer här
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/3189 | Kontakt: Martin Björck 070-7374058, | Facklig företrädare: Jonas Ivarsson, SACO 08-12314458, Tommy Mäntynen, Vision tommy.mantynen@regionstockholm.se, Thérèse Juvall, Akademikerförbundet SSR 08-12313942, | Publicerat: 2025-05-02 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-25

title: Integration Manager
description:
**About Kambi**
*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*
*Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*
**About the Role:**
 Kambi is seeking an Integration Manager to join our dynamic Integration Management Team. As an Integration Manager, you will work closely with your teammates to drive integration projects and serve as the technical contact for new Partners joining Kambi’s network. You will also collaborate with your team to lead changes and enhancement work for onboarded Partners.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Act as the main point of contact for all technical questions during integration projects.
* Engage in technical discussions with Partners and their 3rd party integrators to understand and map their needs to Kambi’s product areas.
* Communicate effectively across cultures and hierarchies to drive and coordinate with stakeholders and teams from external parties across different time zones.
* Liaise with internal Kambi teams, including Engineering Operations, Engineering Development, Business Development, Partner Success Department, Sales, and other operational teams.
* Continuously develop integrations as a technical field by driving standardization, support processes, and documentation together with other Kambi teams.


**Who You Are:**
 You possess excellent communication and organizational skills and have an intuitive understanding of how large-scale technical systems can work together. You should be able to manage multiple projects simultaneously and can structure, prioritize, and follow up on multiple concurrent tasks with many stakeholders, both internal and external. You are comfortable taking responsibility for Kambi and our products and services, and comfortable making decisions. You have an eagerness to learn and a flexible mindset as Kambi and the Integration team are always evolving.
   

  

**About the Team:** 
 The Integration Management Team at Kambi is a close-knit group of highly skilled professionals who are passionate about delivering top-notch integration solutions. Our 5 team members thrive in a collaborative environment where open communication, mutual support, and continuous learning are valued.
   

  

 Based in our Stockholm office, we work closely with various internal departments in all our offices and external partners across the globe to ensure seamless integration processes. Our team is known for its expertise, dedication, and ability to handle complex technical challenges with ease.
   

  

**Why You'll Love Kambi:**
 At Kambi, you will thrive in a high-paced work environment, enjoy taking active ownership and initiative, and feel comfortable speaking your mind. You have high expectations of yourself and your peers and believe that business value delivered defines success.
   

  

 At Kambi we believe in the importance of work-life-balance and making that culture part of our day-to-day. We believe that you as well as Kambi benefit from having happy, healthy colleagues. Additionally, Kambi offers a hybrid work setup, allowing you to balance remote work with in-office collaboration, providing flexibility and support for your work-life balance.
   

  

**What’s in It for You:**
 You will have the opportunity to work in a successful and fast-growing company with a fun and flexible working culture. You will collaborate with smart and humble people in an international work environment. You will be part of a dedicated and supportive team that values your input and encourages professional growth. You will engage in continuous learning and development opportunities and work on challenging and impactful projects that make a difference.
   

  

 If you want to be part of a dedicated team in central Stockholm, please apply with your CV and cover letter.
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

***Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace***
*If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.*
***Creating an inclusive environment***
*We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.*
*#wearekambi*

title: Development Engineer Working on Future Electrified Powertrains
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Do you want to work in a team where ideas turn into reality quickly and where your software can be tested in a truck the same day it's written? We are now looking for a new team member to join our dynamic group working with the electric propulsion system at Traton. In this role, you will be part of a skilled and diverse team developing advanced control and safety functions for electric vehicles. Our environment is agile, collaborative, and hands-on, allowing you to contribute from day one while continuously growing your skills in software, control, and system development.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 As a part of our team, you will work with developing and fine-tuning control algorithms that govern torque control, drivability, and hardware protection for electric vehicles. Your daily tasks will involve modeling and simulation, implementing software changes, and verifying functionality both in virtual environments and in real trucks. Collaboration with cross-functional teams is a natural part of your work, and you will regularly participate in hands-on testing, including expeditions to challenging environments like northern Sweden and southern Europe.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* You have a master’s degree in mechatronics, electrical engineering, systems engineering, or a related field.
* You have experience or coursework in control theory, electric motor control, signal processing, embedded programming, or hydraulics.
* You are comfortable working with tools such as MATLAB and Simulink for modeling and simulation.
* You are adaptable and solution-oriented when faced with new challenges or late changes.
* You communicate fluently in English; Swedish is a plus.
* You either have prior experience in embedded software development or are a recent graduate with a strong drive to learn.


 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 We are a diverse team of engineers working with electric machine control, safety functions, and Hardware protection for Traton's electric propulsion system. Our work blends control theory, software development, and real-world testing—often within the same day. We value collaboration, curiosity, and fast feedback loops. As part of our team, you’ll get to see your ideas come to life quickly and contribute directly to the shift toward sustainable transport. Our yearly expeditions to challenging test environments in both cold and warm climates keep us connected to the real-world impact of our work.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation.
   

  

**We Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes. Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-05-16. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period.
   

  

 Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact Vaheed Nezhadali, recruiting manager at vaheed.nezhadali@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Account Manager till Erlang Solutions
description:
About the Company
 



 Erlang Solutions is a global technology company specializing in building distributed, scalable, and high-performance systems using open-source tools like Erlang and Elixir. They help companies like Klarna, Ericsson, Meta, and WhatsApp develop robust technical platforms that can handle extremely high loads and large volumes of concurrent users.
 



 With offices in Stockholm, London, Krakow, and Budapest, we are 120+ passionate employees and part of Trifork Group. Erlang Solutions culture is driven by innovation, openness, and a strong passion for technology and customer success.
 



  





 About the Role
 



 As an Account Manager, you will play a key role in their Nordic sales team. You will be responsible for building strong, long-term customer relationships, identifying new business opportunities, and selling our consulting services, support solutions, and training within the Erlang/Elixir ecosystem. You will work with clients in industries such as fintech, telecom, media, and digital health, where high availability and performance are crucial.
 



  





 Responsibilities
 


* Identify and pursue new business opportunities.
* Manage the entire sales cycle from prospecting to closing.
* Develop and nurture relationships with both new and existing customers.
* Work closely with technical teams to create solutions that meet customer needs.
* Represent Erlang Solutions at networking events, conferences, and industry gatherings.



  





 Your Profile
 


* Experience in B2B sales within tech, IT, or consulting industries.
* Comfortable managing complex deals, often with technical decision-makers.
* Strong relationship builder and advisor to customers at all levels, from developers to C-suite executives.
* Self-driven and results-oriented in an entrepreneurial environment.
* Fluent in English (both spoken and written); Swedish is a plus.
* A strong interest in technology and innovation is a plus.



  





 They Offer
 


* Flexible working arrangements: remote, hybrid, or office-based.
* Support from world-leading Erlang and Elixir tech specialists.
* An open and inclusive culture with a strong focus on professional development.
* The opportunity to influence your role and our future growth in the Nordics.
* International career opportunities within Trifork Group.



  





 Location: Stockholm
 



 Start: By agreement
 



  





 You will also have the opportunity to participate in a one-year sales training program with Mikael Arndt, including 25 diploma-awarding sales courses and weekly live lectures.
 



 Additionally, you will have the chance to attend Sweden's largest sales event at the Oscar Theatre and a two-day on-site sales training in Stockholm to further develop your sales skills.
 



  





 In this recruitment, Erlang Solutions is collaborating with the recruitment company Saleshub. If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact the responsible recruiter at Berivan.Bozan@saleshub.se

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

**About the Role:**
*We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.*
*We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.*
 As a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 , you will take on the important role of defining, building and maintaining our host of shared cloud services. You'll be a key member of our autonomous and self-organized Cloud Team, working with modern technologies such as Azure, .NET, C#, Entity Framework Core, Terraform, and more.
   

  

**In this role, you’ll work with:**
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and implement cloud-based solutions using Azure services and other relevant technologies.
* Writing efficient, scalable, and maintainable code in Azure, latest .NET, C#, backend applications with ASP.NET Core, Entity Framework Core, and related technologies.
* Help build a rigorous definition of all levels of our stacks with concepts like automation, security, repeatability, recoverability, and separation of concerns being top of mind.
* Create and maintain tests for the functionality you and the team have created.
* Participate in code reviews, debugging, quality assuring and troubleshooting to ensure high-quality deliverables.
* Continuously learn and stay up to date with the latest industry trends and best practices, actively sharing knowledge with team members.
* Contribute to the improvement of our software development processes, tools, and methodologies.


**What we’re looking for:**
 We’re looking for someone who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoys working closely with others to solve technical challenges. We also believe that you have the ability to clearly articulate ideas, visions and plans effectively. You’re proactive and continuously seek opportunities to improve ways of working, contribute to new ideas and share knowledge that elevates the team.
   

  

 For this position, we’re looking for someone on a Senior level with:
   

  

* Solid experience working with Azure, .NET, C#, backend applications, Entity Framework Core, and related technologies.
* Solid experience working with Cloud infrastructure and the definitions of the same through Infrastructure as code practices
* Proven track record of successfully delivering software projects, focusing on quality, scalability, and performance.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze and resolve complex technical challenges.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Distribution Partner Account Manager
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
Splunk, a Cisco company, is building a safer and more resilient digital world with an end-to-end full stack platform made for a hybrid, multi-cloud world. Leading enterprises use our unified security and observability platform to keep their digital systems secure and reliable. Our customers love our technology, but it's our caring employees that make Splunk stand out as an amazing career destination. No matter where in the world or what level of the organization, we approach our work with kindness. So bring your work experience, problem-solving skills and talent, of course, but also bring your joy, your passion and all the things that make you, you. Come help organizations be their best, while you reach new heights with a team that has your back.
   

  

 Role
   

  

 We are seeking an outstanding “Distribution Partner Account Manager” for our North EMEA region to help Splunk support and grow our distribution partners. The role has the primary responsibility to meet and exceed, quarterly and annual revenue quota assignments for specified distributor(s) and growing Splunk's business in the distribution channel. This includes the understanding of distributor business goals and requirements, and being involved in the presentation of Splunk product, solution and technology propositions to distribution salespeople.
   

  

 Responsibilities I want to and can do that!
   

  

* Meet and exceed revenue and bookings quotas in assigned channel.
* Consistently deliver aggressive license, support and service revenue targets – commitment to the number and to deadlines
* Account planning and opportunity management with the distribution and distribution managed channel
* Lead sales efforts with distribution and distribution managed channel
* Enable distributor & partners in our selling and product methodology
* Recruit onboarding and training to new partners
* Execute partner/sales marketing activities aligned with sales quota (marketing, campaign, cross-selling, pipeline generation and quota retirement)
* Manage interface between Splunk and channel/distributor. Manage channel conflict.
* Interact with Splunk direct sales team
* Work with Splunk Sales RSMs and Channel PSM´s to build and manage demand generation and marketing efforts
* Drive marketing activities with complementary technology partners
* Ensure partners are driving towards certification requirements and Partnerverse compliance metrics


 Ensure channel/distributors meet and exceed goals by
   

  

* Understanding channel/distributors business strategies
* Communicating channel/distributors business strategies to relevant departments in Splunk
* Understanding and presenting Splunk value proposition (corporate, positioning, products, technologies, capabilities) to distributors and VARs.
* Managing channel/distributors product focus.
* Managing quarterly and ad-hoc promotional activities at channel/distributors.
* Training channel/distributors salespeople.
* Monitoring and reporting competitive activities and sales.
* Monitoring and reporting on distributor POS sales
* Adjusting sales activities and product mix as needed based on POS sales.
* Managing co-marketing opportunities with channel partners and third-party allies.
* Satisfy internal reporting requirements by submitting reports and records in accordance with company policies and practices.
* Participate in trade shows and make presentations, as required.
* Travel to distributor locations for mindshare, enablement and training


 Requirements I've already done that!
   

  

* 5+ years of Distribution Partner Account Manager in a fast-growing software company
* 5+ years of Distributor and VARs experience within a technology company that is similar to Splunk’s industry
* Recent and previous success exceeding revenue and bookings quotas in a distribution channel
* Experience identifying new resellers and prioritizing Distribution’s for a company’s team
* Success and references to prove the success from working with direct sales teams and sales leaders
* Experience strategizing and managing Distributors and exceeding goals
* Experience with analyzing and reporting actives related to sales and revenue activities
* Forecasting commitments and forecasting accuracy
* Fluent in Swedish and English (both written and spoken)


****Splunk is an Equal Opportunity Employer****
****Splunk, a Cisco company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.****
 Note

title: People Operations Specialist (temporary role 12 months)
description:
**Do you have experience working with people operations, building and developing efficient people processes and have a big interest in HR tech? We are looking for an People Operations Specialist to our People & Culture team.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a People Operations Specialist who wants to make a difference.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are now looking for an People Operations Specialist to join our People & Culture team, covering a 12-month maternity leave. In this role, you will drive key people processes, manage our HR systems and tools, conduct people analytics, and provide support to managers and employees on various HR topics.
   

  

 If you enjoy working in a fast-paced, international environment and thrive on optimizing processes and systems, this is a great opportunity to contribute to meaningful work within our organization.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As People Operations Specialist, your main focus will be:
   

  

* Managing HR systems (HRIS and other tools), ensuring continuous improvements, configurations, and training.
* Developing and maintaining key people processes such as onboarding, offboarding, and employment changes.
* Coordinating annual salary reviews and conducting equal pay audits.
* Managing regular employee engagement surveys, including analytics.
* Overseeing employee documentation, such as employment contracts, addendums and other employment records.
* Analyzing people data to deliver actionable insights and providing regular reporting on HR metrics to support strategic decision-making.
* Providing guidance and support to employees and managers on HR-related matters.


 You will be part of a team of nine and report directly to the Chief People & Culture Officer.
   

  

**Your Potential Background**
 We’re looking for someone with experience from the following:
   

  

* Relevant HR education and 3+ years of experience in a broad HR role, preferably within an international environment.
* Strong technical skills and experience with HRIS systems and other HR tools.
* Proven experience in building and developing core people processes.
* Excellent communication skills in both English and Swedish.


 Due to the sensitivity of our work, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.
   

  

**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!
