title: Cloud Migration Project Manager to SEB in Solna
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
 SEB is in the midst of a cloud transformation, migrating key IT infrastructure components to a modern cloud environment. We’re looking for a skilled Project Manager to lead this transformation and ensure successful implementation.
   

  

 As the banking sector transforms with new technologies and regulations, SEB is evolving to become an IT-driven business. We embrace agile development to deliver fast, customer-focused solutions. This transition to cloud-based solutions requires a deep understanding of both on-premises requirements and cloud possibilities, with a strong focus on security and accessibility
   

  

**Role Description**
 As Cloud Migration Project Manager, you will lead the migration for Development Solution & Infrastructure, working with IT stakeholders to define the scope, manage progress, and ensure alignment with business goals. You will coordinate teams and drive the cloud migration process to completion.
   

  

 To thrive in this role, we believe you have a broad IT experience, spanning both on-prem based infrastructure and a good understanding of the cloud-based prerequisites for IT infrastructure. We also believe that you have experience in different project management methods and tools and that you have a hybrid delivery perspective mixing long term planning with an agile approach
   

  

 The Main Objective Will Be To Define And Set Scope For DSI’s Cloud Migration Journey. This Is Not Limited To, But Includes
   

  

* Define and drive the scope of the Cloud migration for the area Development Solution & Infrastructure within SEB
* Analyze the current potential of cloud migration objects within Development Solution & Infrastructure
* Cater and enable the migration together with the maintenance team of the object
* Lead the work associated with the migration tasks
* Report progress to a steering committee
* Document decisions and execute them as needed


**Requirements**
* Extensive experience in IT infrastructure, including both on-prem and cloud solutions.
* Track record of delivering on large scale cloud or infrastructure projects
* Comfortable to discuss and influence IT architecture
* Self-going and self-managed
* Strong experience in leading cloud migration projects with specialized teams and navigate diverse perspectives.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to foster collaboration across teams and stakeholders.
* Fluent in both English and Swedish


**What We Offer**
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Access to SEB staff banking and exclusive benefits.
* A prestigious team with experienced colleagues who value cooperation and openness.
* Opportunity to share knowledge by pair programming, demos, etc.
* A workplace where we care about the work-life balance.
* An innovative company at the forefront of technology
* Hybrid Workplace Setup
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than
 **31st of May 2025.**
 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Datacenter & Network Operations Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Data
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
   

  

 As a Data Center Engineer in the Data Center Engineering & Operations group, the ideal candidate will have the knowledge and experience to work in a fast paced Data Center environment. They will be responsible for the day-to-day operations and projects to ensure the continued success of Salesforce.com.
   

  

**Team**
 Salesforce is looking for an addition to our expanding Data Center Operations team. To join this team, you'll need to have a passion for technology, and love working with the next generation of trust enterprise computing in the world. We're a fast-paced, agile, and innovative team. We're highly collaborative and work across all areas of our the Data center technology stack. We focus on availability of our critical services for the business, qualify complex compute changes, and trail-blaze new engineering solutions for the cloud.
   

  

 As a key member of our team, you will work in a high-paced operations environment of Salesforce, the largest SaaS platform on the planet, working on the delivery and operations of scalable and innovative solutions for our modular compute infrastructure and proactively defending and securing our customers' data.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Conduct all day-to-day operations for the Data Center
* Installation of racks/enclosures and preparation of equipment to be installed.
* Update cable management system as changes are made to data center cable plant
* Update asset management system as equipment is added and removed from the data center
* Define tasks for each project and work with all Tech and Prod teams to meet project timelines as well as provide status to team members and management on the completion of all tasks
* Provide all information to assist with Data Center capacity planning for space and power.
* Handle all vendor resources to complete tasks as defined in SOWs
* Maintain relationship with providers to ensure day-to-day operational success
* Research new Data Center infrastructure equipment advancements and recommend changes as needed
* Conduct all audits as required by company policies
* Coordinate with the onsite delivery and shipping of all equipment.
* Will be part of an on-call weekly rotation shared across the Stockholm Engineering team


**Required Skills**
* Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent and relevant work experience
* 5+ years experience with Data Centers managing hardware assets
* Project management approach with the ability to handle tasks in short timeframes
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written in English
* Extensive experience with rack and stack of server and network equipment installations
* Solid day-to-day experience working in large, fast-paced heterogeneous environments, critical production data centers and co-location environments
* Solid experience working with teams of onsite infrastructure build out engineers and vendors
* Experience with a large variety of different vendor hardware such as servers, storage, and network equipment.
* Familiar with the processes of pulling, terminating and testing copper and fiber network cabling. Experience with performing inventories of all cable, power cords and other infrastructure items.
* Experience in contributing to detailed project plans for programs involving multi-functional teams and complex requirements
* Ability to multitask and manage numerous projects
* Demonstrated ability to coordinate issue resolution across departmental teams and global teams within multiple time zones
* Coordinating vendors, scheduling RMA's and on-site repairs as needed
* Experience with Asset Management systems
* Solid understanding of disaster recovery and business continuance methodology
* Strong sense of methodology, process, and metrics including familiarity with Agile and Scrum methodologies


**Desired Skills**
* Consistent record of success and delivering results
* Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills conducive to team development
* Physical work ability to lift at least 20-30 kg on a regular basis (server lifts are in use)
* Ability to travel nationally or internationally for training and in support of our growing remote locations


 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Data Engineer to Savings Offering at SEB in Stockholm
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech aena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
**About The Role**
 The Data and Integrations team within Savings Offering is looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our transformation journey to develop a new savings investment platform. You will focus on building scalable and secure services to handle data. Your role involves leading the creation of pipelines to integrate data from various sources, including databases, mainframe systems, APIs, and message queues. You will work in the Google Cloud Platform environment and be involved in decision-making and technical guidance for the Savings Investments tribe.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Build scalable and secure services for data within and outside the Savings Investment area.
* Implement the technical roadmap for SEB's journey to Google Cloud Platform.
* Collaborate with architects, developers, and stakeholders.
* Participate in code reviews, mob programming, and knowledge sharing.


*We use a wide range of technologies, and the followings serve only as an example:*
* Container-based technology: Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift, and others.
* Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Infrastructure as Code: Terraform.
* API development: GraphQL, REST APIs, Swagger.
* Programming languages: Python and bash scripts.
* Databases: BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Redis or any relational, non-relational, in-memory databases that are suitable for the work.
* DevSecOps tools.


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
 We are seeking a skilled data engineer with a technical background in data integration, pipelines, and management. You should be a team player with great communication skills, a positive mindset, and the ability to collaborate and motivate others in a multicultural environment.
   

  

**Key Qualifications**
* Several years of software development experience and some experience with Cloud, preferably Google Cloud Platform.
* Ability to navigate GCP services, discuss them in detail, and quickly prototype designs.
* Understanding of system design and data structures.
* Forward-thinking mindset to drive change and continuous improvement.
* Analytical mindset to tackle complex business and technical challenges with the team's help.


 We aim to lead SEB's digital transformation towards GCP and expect you to drive your work and potentially lead the technology within the team
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Attractive compensation and benefits.
* Hybrid way of working.
* Work-life balance.
* Friendly and welcoming culture.
* International opportunities and working environment.
* Agile and modern ways of working.


**About**
**Learn more about working at SEB www.sebgroup.com/career**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe in or where they come from.
   

  

**Great people often know great people – please share if you have a friend who would love this job.**
**Ready to join?**
 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 31st of May. If you have questions about the position, please contact the hiring manager, Thanh Truong, at thanh.truong@seb.se

title: Senior Client Executive, International Corporate Clients | SEB, Stockholm
description:
International Corporate Clients söker en erfaren och affärsdriven Senior Client Executive som vill och vara med och forma hur vi utvecklar våra kundrelationer, vårt erbjudande – och vårt sätt att arbeta.
   

  

 Det här är en spännande möjlighet för dig som vill kombinera strategiskt kundansvar med affärsutveckling, segmentfokus och eget initiativtagande.
   

  

 Vi är en specialist- och kundansvarsenhet inom SEB:s affärsområde International Clients, med uppdraget att driva och utveckla affären mot ett antal utvalda kundsegment. Vårt huvudsakliga fokus ligger på internationella företagskunder med verksamhet i Sverige och Norden, men vi har också ett växande uppdrag inom kommuner, stiftelser, offentliga aktörer och andra samhällsnära organisationer – ett område vi benämner som vårt public-segment.
   

  

 Våra kunder är ofta komplexa och har höga krav, vilket kräver ett nära samarbete mellan kundansvariga och interna produkt- och specialistfunktioner. Här får du arbeta med strategiska kundrelationer, utmanande affärer och långsiktiga relationer – i en miljö där vi kombinerar affärsmässighet med samhällsnytta.
   

  

 Rollen ger dig inte bara ansvar för kundrelationer, utan även möjlighet att påverka hur vi utvecklar affären i våra olika segment, inklusive hur vi utformar vårt erbjudande, effektiviserar vår kundbearbetning och arbetar strategiskt med regelverksfrågor. Det gör det här till en roll för dig som vill vara nära kunden och samtidigt bidra till riktningen framåt.
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Som Client Executive i vårt team får du ett helhetsansvar för en portfölj av företagskunder. Du är kundens huvudkontakt i banken, leder kunddialoger och skapar tillsammans med våra produktspecialister lösningar som stärker kundens affär – och vår.
   

  

 Utöver Kundansvaret Kommer Du Att Ha En Viktig Roll i Teamets Affärsutveckling. Det Innebär Att Du Driver Egna Initiativ Och Projekt Kopplade Till
   

  

* Hur vi arbetar mer effektivt mot olika kundtyper.
* Hur vi sätter SEB:s erbjudande i nya eller befintliga segment.
* Hur vi arbetar strategiskt med compliance och regelverksfrågor.
* Hur vi vidareutvecklar vårt public-segment och maximerar dess långsiktiga potential.


**Du Kommer Att**
* Vara huvudansvarig kontaktperson för en portfölj av företagskunder inom våra segment.
* Identifiera och driva affärsmöjligheter inom hela SEB:s produktutbud.
* Koordinera tvärfunktionella team inom och utanför enheten för att leverera kundvärde.
* Leda strategiska kunddialoger och affärsgenomgångar.
* Driva egna projekt kopplat till affärsutveckling, segmentering och compliance.
* Driva proaktiv hållbarhetsrådgivning genom att identifiera hållbarhetsrisker och, genom strategisk dialog, bidra till kundernas omställning.


 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* Har gedigen erfarenhet av kundansvar, gärna mot komplexa företagskunder eller offentliga organisationer.
* Förstår helheten i hur bankens produkter skapar kundvärde och är trygg i behovsdriven rådgivning.
* Är proaktiv, självgående och har en stark inre kompass i hur du bygger affärer.
* Har ett strategiskt synsätt och trivs med att förbättra arbetssätt, flöden och strukturer.
* Har erfarenhet av eller intresse för att arbeta med regelverksfrågor och compliance.
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska.
* Har Swedsec-licens (inkl. försäkringsdistribution) eller är villig att ta den.


 Vi anpassar nivån på rollen – Client Executive eller Senior Client Executive – utifrån din erfarenhet.
   

  

 Våra erbjudande till dig
   

  

* Ett internationellt arbetsklimat med starkt kundfokus.
* En teamkultur präglad av tillit, samarbete och högt engagemang.
* En chans att vara med och forma affären i ett team under utveckling.
* Flexibilitet och frihet att påverka din roll.
* Då många av våra kunder befinner sig på andra orter i Sverige och Europa förekommer tjänsteresor.
* Ett modernt kontor i Arenastaden, Solna – byggt för samarbete och välmående.


 Vi är 25 kollegor inom SEB International Clients, varav 12 i vårt team som arbetar med företagsaffären. Vi är stolta över vår sammanhållning och det meningsfulla arbete vi gör tillsammans.
   

  

 Redo att ta nästa steg i din karriärresa?
   

  

 Välkommen till vår inkluderande kultur där våra gemensamma värderingar inspirerar och lyfter vårt team. Vi värdesätter mångfald och strävar efter att alla medarbetare ska känna sig sedda, hörda och uppskattade.
   

  

 Vi gör urval löpande – skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast 8 maj 2025.
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att höra av dig till August Beckman, Head of International Corporate Clients på august.beckman@seb.se
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på SEB här: www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 Vi är övertygade om att inkludering och mångfald är avgörande för vår framtida framgång. Vi strävar efter en inkluderande och värderingsdriven kultur där medarbetare känner sig uppskattade, respekterade och engagerade oavsett vilka de är, vad de tror på eller var de kommer ifrån.

title: Second line support inom cloudtjänster
description:
Flera av våra kunder behöver förstärka sin IT-avdelning inom 2nd line support och Microsoft Azure. Har du erfarenhet inom Windows Server och Cloudtjänster med fokus på Microsoft tjänseutbud? Då är detta något för dig!
   

  

 Uppdraget är på heltid och kommer att pågå tills vidare.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Arbetsuppgifterna kommer bestå av installation, driftsättning, support och felsökning av olika IT-tjänster som Microsoft Azure, Windows servrar och nätverkslösningar. Du kommer att arbeta i företagets 2nd line-gruppering och hantera ärenden som är av mer kvalificerad karaktär och som har eskalerats via 1st line. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att innefatta supportering och felsökning av kundspecifika applikationer samt standardapplikationer som Microsoft 365 och Exchange. Här kommer du, tillsammans med dina kollegor, att arbeta nära kunderna med allt från små till stora uppdrag.
   

  

 Utöver detta kommer du även att arbeta med bland annat administration av Active Directory samt övervakning och felsökning av nätverk och skrivare.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 För att lyckas i den här rollen ser vi att du har lång erfarenhet från djupare felsökning, som att kunna läsa loggar och urskilja vad som framgår i dessa. Du har erfarenhet av Windows Server 2012 och uppåt så att du kan både sätta upp en server och drifta befintliga servrar.
   

  

 Som person är du ansvarstagande, serviceminded och lyhörd. Utöver ett tekniskt kunnande ska du också ha lätt för teamwork då bolagets målsättning är attt genuint omhänderta och serva sina kunder på absolut bästa sätt. Kundarbetet sköts primärt digitalt men kan i vissa fall även ske på plats, därför förväntas du kommunicera flytande på svenska och engelska såväl i tal såväl som i skrift.
   

  

*Krav*
* Tydlig erfarenhet av Microsoft 365 inklusice Azure Domain Services
* Erfarenhet av planering om genomförande av systemmigrering vare sig det gäller operativsystem, affärssystem eller andra applikationer
* Erfarenhet av klientmanagering (RMM-system)
* God nätverksförståelse


*Det är meriterande om du även har erfarenhet, kunskap och utbildning inom:*
* Virtualisering – Hyper-V eller VMware
* MDM-lösningar
* Cisco Routing & Switching, Cisco Security och Cisco Wifi


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande och roliga aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under trevliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, och med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Guidewire Analyst
description:
**Role** 
 : Guidewire Analyst
 



**Location**

**Experience**

**Skills Required**

 We at Coforge are hiring Guidewire Analyst professional with the following skillset:

title: Linux Desktop Support Associate (London UK office)
description:
This is an opportunity to kickstart your career by joining Canonical. You will be working from our Canonical London Office and will be accountable for delivering technical support to our employees and customers, as well as facilitating AV support for office conferences and events. From problem qualification to full resolution, you will own and manage your cases. When needed, you will transfer your cases to your colleagues or involve senior engineers.
   

  

 Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 This is an opportunity for an Linux Engineer/Administrator with a passion for Linux and Customer Success to build a career with Canonical and support the technical needs of customers leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have a passion for technology and an eagerness to learn, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

 You will be accountable for delivering an outstanding technical support experience on the full Desktop and Server technical stack at Canonical. From problem qualification to full resolution, you will own and manage your cases. When needed, you will transfer your cases to your colleagues or involve senior engineers.
   

  

 Your day to day job is to provide technical expertise, be an excellent communicator and a service-oriented professional. Every day you will have to make judgement calls to prioritise customer issues and maximise your effectiveness. You will also need to set time aside to learn about our new products and technologies and evolve as a professional. You will participate in various training sessions, team gatherings and Company events.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Office Based in London, England
   

  

**The role entails**
* Investigate issues reported by customers by researching and escalating issues
* Work to resolve complex customer problems related to Canonical's portfolio of products.
* Ownership of results: Ensure that each support case owned by you is handled according to our Service Level Agreement (SLA) with the highest possible customer satisfaction by setting the right expectations and fulfilling your commitments.
* Engage directly with customers and work collaboratively by phone, ticketing system, and remote sessions to resolve their issues.
* Participate in a regular weekend working rotation.
* Contribute new knowledge base articles and maintain existing articles, ensuring shared knowledge and lessons learned are available to customers.
* Understanding Ubuntu development process to be able to set customer expectations correctly on timeline for a fix.


**What are we looking for in you** 
  

  

* Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
* Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
* Work from our new, state of the art London, UK office and provide technical support for employees.
* Familiarize with and own the technical infrastructure supporting the office and the stack supporting events and customer demos.
* Provide technical onboarding support for new employees.
* Provide technical and infrastructure support during office events.
* Identify and suggest any opportunities to provide a better service
* Experience with Linux troubleshooting (collecting logs and stack traces, fine-tuning by editing configuration files)
* Experience with Linux integration with other environments (authentication/directory services, network file systems, etc.)
* Troubleshooting experience:
+ Linux integration with other environments (authentication/directory services, network file systems, etc.).
+ Ability to navigate effectively stack traces and logs, and advise on next steps.
+ Solid understanding of OS and Application level bugs and when to escalate to the correct team.

* Ability to learn quickly, thrive on change and handle the pressure of a customer facing job
* Programming fundamentals in any language.
* Ability to travel internationally twice a year for company events up to two weeks long
* Extensive Customer support experience is key:
+ Customer needs are top priority.
+ Communicate professionally, emphatically, clearly and set the right expectations.


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Lawyer for IBM Sweden
description:
**Introduction**
 You will become part of the global IBM Legal organization and more specifically the Northern Central and Eastern Europe (NCEE) Legal Team. The NCEE Legal team consists of 19 lawyers throughout the region, reporting to the NCEE Legal Counsel. The NCEE Legal Team is an experienced and highly appreciated legal team that works closely with the company’s business units. The role is currently based in Kista, but as from September 2025 it will be based in central Stockholm. Limited travel can be expected.
   

  

**Your Role And Responsibilities**
 Your main responsibility will be to support the Swedish business by negotiating and providing legal advice relating to different types of IT-services agreements and public tenders (including a wide range of IT consultancy services) as well as agreements for IBM standard offerings, e.g. software and cloud. You will also provide limited legal advice within other areas of law such as for example labour-, marketing- and corporate law.
   

  

**Preferred Education**
 Master's Degree
   

  

**Required Technical And Professional Expertise**
 A proactive work approach with a strong sense of ownership and leadership is important to succeed in the role. A growth mindset is key since you will have the opportunity to continuously learn and build expertise.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Commercial lawyer with a love for negotiations
* Ability to show integrity under pressure and balance the requirements of different internal and external stakeholders
* Proven problem-solver with an ability to find creative legal solutions to complex issues
* Hands on and can-do approach
* Agile with a strong sense of ownership and leadership.
* Strong skills for clear and crisp communication and working proficiency (verbal/written) in Swedish and English.
* Master of Laws Degree from a Swedish university and a minimum of 4 years of professional experience as a lawyer, preferably from a well-renowned law firm or from an in-house counsel role.
* Experience with IT service contracts would be an advantage, but not a requirement.

title: Principal Account Manager, GenAI Startups
description:
**Description**
 Join us in shaping the future of Artificial Intelligence! We're seeking a collaborative and innovative Principal Account Manager to nurture relationships with cutting-edge AI startups and help them transform industries through AWS technology.
   

  

 About the Team Our team partners with the most innovative AI startups, helping them build and scale ground-breaking solutions on AWS. We foster an inclusive environment where creativity and collaboration thrive, working closely with various AWS teams to provide comprehensive support to our startup customers.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Build and nurture relationships with startup founders, executives, and key stakeholders
* Develop comprehensive account strategies to drive mutual growth and innovation
* Create and execute go-to-market plans with cross-functional teams
* Guide startups through their cloud journey, ensuring successful adoption of AWS services
* Foster partnerships within the AI/ML ecosystem to expand reach and impact


 A day in the life
   

  

 You'll engage with startup founders and executives, understanding their unique challenges and helping them leverage AWS services to achieve their goals. You'll collaborate with solution architects, marketing teams, and business development professionals to create tailored strategies for startup success.
   

  

**About The Team**
 About AWS
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 10+ years experience in software, cloud, or SaaS sales
* 10+ years business development or partner management experience
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
* Experience selling to C-level executives


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in AI/ML business development or partnerships
* Knowledge of generative AI technology and market trends
* Track record of developing successful go-to-market strategies
* Experience working with venture-backed startups
* Proficiency in Swedish, Danish, or Dutch
* Advanced degree in business, technology, or related field


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2951173

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Senior Data Engineer – In-House Opportunity | Stockholm or Hybrid (Sweden)** 




  





 🕒
 *Full-time, Permanent* 




 🌍
 *Location: Stockholm (Hybrid)* 




 🗣
 *Languages: Swedish & English required* 




  





 Are you ready to join a company that’s embracing data at its core and driving transformation across a vital industry in Sweden? A well-established Swedish organization operating at scale is looking for a
 **Senior Data Engineer** 
 to help shape the future of their data-driven decision-making - and be part of an exciting digitalization journey that’s just getting started.
 



  





 🚀 Why You’ll Love This Role
 



 This is not your typical consultancy gig - it’s an
 **in-house role** 
 at a company deeply committed to becoming fully data-driven. You’ll have
 **ownership and long-term impact** 
 , working alongside a team that values collaboration, trust, and a strong sense of purpose. Here, data isn’t just support - it’s strategic.
 



  





 You’ll join a
 **flat and empowered team** 
 where your voice is heard and your ideas help move both the team and the company forward. The tech stack is modern, the projects are meaningful, and your work will directly contribute to better outcomes for thousands of restaurants, cafés, and commercial kitchens across Sweden.
 



  





 👨‍💻 What You’ll Do
 



 As a
 **Senior Data Engineer** 
 , you’ll play a central role in designing and implementing smart, scalable data solutions in a fully cloud-native Azure environment. You’ll help the organization leverage data at every level - operationally and strategically - through:
 



  




* Designing and developing data pipelines using tools in the
 **Azure Data Platform** 
 (e.g., Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks, Fabric).
* Building and optimizing robust data models to support business insights.
* Creating and managing ETL/ELT flows that ensure data quality, reliability, and performance.
* Collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders to understand data needs and translate them into elegant solutions.
* Driving innovation and continuous improvement in the data engineering space.



  





 🎯 What We’re Looking For
 



 We’re looking for a self-motivated and curious professional who enjoys autonomy but also values being part of a collaborative, tight-knit team.
 



  





**Must-Haves:** 



* 2–3+ years of experience as a
 **Data Engineer** 
 ,
 **BI Backend Developer** 
 , or similar.
* Solid experience working with
 **Microsoft Azure’s BI stack** 
 (e.g., Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks, Fabric).
* Strong skills in
 **SQL** 
 and Spark (Python or Scala).
* Experience with
 **dimensional modeling** 
 and data warehousing concepts.
* Fluency in
 **Swedish and English** 
 (spoken and written).
* Degree in IT, Computer Science, Systems Science, or equivalent.



  





**Nice-to-Haves:** 



* Experience with
 **Power BI** 
 , or a desire to learn and work with the frontend as needed.
* Familiarity with
 **object-oriented programming** 
 .
* Agile development experience.
* Background working with Microsoft’s on-prem BI tools (SSIS, SSAS, SQL Server).



  





 🌱 A Culture of Growth & Balance
 


* You’ll be joining a
 **data & analytics team** 
 that is central to the company’s digital strategy.
* Strong
 **work-life balance** 
 : flexible hours and remote work options.
* Supportive leadership and
 **long-term stability** 
 with a well-established Swedish organization.
* Opportunities to upskill, explore new technologies, and shape how data is used throughout the business.
* A fun, friendly team culture - people work hard, support each other, and don’t mind a fika (or a friendly football match) together.



  





 ✨
 **Make a real impact - in a real business - with data that matters.** 




 Apply now to bring your experience to a team where your ideas will help drive digital transformation at scale.

title: Guidewire Analyst
description:
Job Description:
 



  




* Analyze existing Guidewire systems to identify areas for improvement and optimization.
* Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Define and recommend solutions for building systems that operate efficiently across multiple countries.
* Design and implement single instance or multiple instance Guidewire systems based on client requirements.
* Collaborate with business analysts and clients to understand business needs and translate them into technical solutions.
* Ensure the scalability, reliability, and performance of Guidewire systems.

* In-depth knowledge of Guidewire Insurance Suite (Policy Center, Billing Center, Claim Center).

* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Preferred Qualifications: Guidewire certification. Experience with cloud-based Guidewire implementations. Knowledge of Agile methodologies.

title: Senior Project Manager – Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)
description:

 We are looking for a
 **Senior Project Manager** 
 who wants to be a part of Card Issuing. Card Issuing is a leading provider of financial services and solutions both in the Nordics and outside. We offer modular, pre-integrated card as a service solutions and market-leading software. With our size, expertise, and specialization, we empower financial institutions to enhance agility, efficiency, and accelerate digital transformation.
   

  

**When joining Card Issuing as a Senior Project Manager, you will:**
* Be part of a project management team of 16 experienced project managers enjoying the combined knowledge and support of helpful colleagues.
* Manage the implementation and delivery of our solutions.
* Work closely with customers to plan and coordinate projects, ensuring successful deployment and adoption of the system.
* Act as a trusted advisor, helping customers improve their processes and maximize the value of our solutions.


**Who we are looking for:**
* 10+ years of experience in project management, preferably within IT solutions, finance, or the public sector.
* Strong knowledge of financial services is a plus.
* Excellent communication and facilitation skills.
* Structured and proactive mindset with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Fluency in Norwegian and English, both spoken and written.
* Good understanding of PMP or PRINCE2 Agile.
* Proficiency in waterfall project management methodologies.


 As a person, we believe you are an engaged team player who enjoys working with customers, driving projects forward, and ensuring high-quality deliveries. You are self-motivated, solution-oriented, and thrive in a role that combines both independent work and collaboration with colleagues and customers.
   

  

**What we offer:**

In addition, as a company, we offer you professional growth, an open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.

**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application! We will fill the position as soon as we find the right person, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager at tamas.balog@tietoevry.com.

 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. title: Strategic Product Manager/Head of Product Management - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
**Strategic Product Manager/Head of Product Management - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)**
 We are looking for a
 **Strategic Product Manager** 
 who wants to be part of Tietoevry Banking. Tietoevry Banking is the leading financial services software and solution partner in the Nordics. We offer modular, pre-integrated banking as a service solutions and market-leading software for core, payments, credit, cards, financial fraud, and wealth. With our scale, expertise, and specialization, we empower financial institutions to enhance agility, efficiency, and accelerate digital transformation.
   

  

**When joining Tietoevry Banking you will work on:**
* Product Vision and Strategy: Develop and communicate a clear product vision and mid-term/long-term strategy that aligns with the company's overall Strategy, objectives and market trends. Define target customers, licensing and pricing models to address predictable long-term revenue flow. Define complementary services to support successful implementation and maintenance, ensure additional revenue flow.
* Market Analysis: Conduct in-depth market research to understand industry trends, competitive landscape, regulatory changes and customer needs, providing input and recommendations for strategic decisions for mid-term and long-term initiatives. Identify opportunities for product innovation and differentiation.
* Roadmap Development: Ability to translate market needs and business opportunities to a strategic roadmap and balance long/short-term needs. Create and maintain a high-level product roadmap that outlines key milestones, deliverables, and timelines, ensuring alignment with business priorities. Address product lifecycles, including planning sunsetting and migration strategies. Define innovation inception approaches. Plan portfolio modernization to fit market needs, ensure future growth and competitive costs.
* Relationship Building: Establish and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients, partners, and industry influencers to create new business opportunities. Participate, present and be influencer in conferences, industry workgroups. Build relationships with industry stakeholders globally. Demonstrate cultural awareness and the ability to adapt product strategies to various regional requirements.
* Stakeholder management: Collaborate closely with the sales team and engage with other departments, including engineering, marketing, project management and customer teams, to support with sales and ensure successful product development and launch. Cooperate cross-units in Cards and Transaction Banking and other units in Banking.
* Customer Insights: Prepare and present vision, pitches, and presentations to existing and potential clients and partners, effectively communicating the value proposition. Gather and analyze customer feedback and usage data to inform product decisions and enhance user experience.
* Performance Metrics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success and identify areas for improvement, ensure data-based decision making. Keep accountability on product/service profitability. Align models and use cross unit template and processes.
* Go-to-Market Strategy: Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to develop and execute effective go-to-market strategies for product launches and updates. Collaborate with Security, Compliance and Privacy teams to identify market or country potential risks and opportunities.
* Risk Management: Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful product delivery and adoption.
* Leadership and Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to product managers and team members, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.


**Who we are looking for:**
* A Bachelor's degree in business, Marketing, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
* Proven experience in product management, with a focus on strategic planning and execution.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.
* Experience in Cards and Payments, with a large network of connections with industry experts and decision-makers.
* Familiarity with European and Nordic customers.


**We also believe you have:**
* Strong strategic thinking skills to develop and implement effective product strategies.
* A market and customer focus that drives product innovation and meets customer needs.
* Excellent relationship-building abilities to establish connections with clients, partners, and industry stakeholders.
* Proficiency in public speaking to effectively present ideas and influence audiences.
* Strong negotiation and influencing skills to advocate for product initiatives and secure buy-in.
* A creative mindset that fosters innovation and the development of unique solutions.
* A results-oriented approach that emphasizes accountability and achievement of product goals.


 As a person, we believe you are a team player who takes action and demonstrates responsibility to organize your work and solve your tasks. With our agile end-to-end development process, you will continue to both learn from and coach your colleagues, so communication is important for us. Technology is developing fast, so learning new cutting-edge technologies is something you strive to do.
   

  

**What we offer:**
* We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, an open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance!
* We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.
* Competitive salary (up to 7,000 EUR gross per month in Latvia), based on experience and qualifications.
* Finally, we believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.


**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application! Interviews will be held continuously, so we encourage you to apply today! For more information or questions, please contact the Talent Acquisition team at recruitmentinbanking@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!

title: Global Payroll Administrator
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We're looking for an exceptional payroll administrator with experience of working with outsourced payroll bureaus (US, UK, EU and/or additional jurisdictions) to manage the company's end to end global payroll and contractor payments. You'll have domain expertise in processing payroll in different countries. You are reliable, diligent and pay attention to details and always work towards improving current processes.
   

  

 Location: This role may choose to be office based out of London or home based, and will report to our Global Financial Controller.
   

  

 This role entails
   

  

* Ensure all payrolls are always delivered on time and with 100% accuracy
* Process the payroll/contractor data in an organised and structured manner
* Manage all payroll deadlines and monthly payroll tasks
* Prepare payroll reports and provide monthly payroll data in journal format to finance for processing
* Comply with GDPR regulations and maintain payroll security/confidentiality
* Deal with payroll queries and resolve or escalate as required
* Constantly seek out ways to improve systems and processes to ensure a seamless flow between HR, Payroll and Finance
* Keep payroll policies up to date and write any new procedures as required
* Provide support to any project related activities from Finance and HR
* Provide support to Finance with reporting and audit queries
* Assist with future expansions of global payrolls and other projects
* Manage all payroll correspondence and act as a point of contact for all escalated payroll queries
* Maintain strong cross-functional team relationships
* Build strong relationships with vendors to ensure excellent service delivery and compliance in all countries


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Experience in a similar payroll role or working with outsourced payroll bureaus
* Excellent communication skills to converse with external parties and internal team members of all levels
* Strong process and planning mindset
* Ability to think outside the box and solve problems when faced with new challenges
* Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail
* Exceptional planning/organisational skills and being deadline oriented
* Ability to work with different software systems, and have excellent knowledge of spreadsheets and formulas
* Being a team player as well as being able to work independently


**What we offer you**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Commercial Engineer
description:
Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Trusted by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado Customer Experience Cloud empowers brands to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and grow their businesses.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Commercial Engineer at Voyado, you'll step into an exciting role at the intersection of technology, sales, partnerships
 **,** 
 and strategy. Supporting our Engage product, you’ll combine technical expertise with commercial acumen to drive our sales efforts and support our partners. You’ll play a pivotal role in understanding customer needs, delivering compelling product demonstrations, and tailoring solutions that address client challenges.
   

  

 If you thrive on blending tech-savvy insights with commercial problem-solving, this is your chance to shine!
   

  

 What you'll be up to
   

  

* Collaborate with the sales team and partners to identify customer needs and deliver tailored technical solutions.
* Conduct in-depth product demonstrations and technical presentations to showcase the capabilities of Voyado Engage.
* Address technical challenges, customizing solutions to ensure alignment with client requirements.
* Act as a bridge between sales, partner managers, and product teams, translating technical details into clear business benefits.
* Stay updated on product enhancements, industry trends, and the competitive landscape.


**About You**
 We’re looking for a dynamic professional ready to take the next step in their career. Ideally, you have a technical background and a business-oriented mindset, enjoy problem-solving, thrive in a collaborative environment, and have a knack for translating complex technical details into compelling value propositions.
   

  

*What We’re Looking Fo* 
*r:*
* Proven experience as a Sales Engineer, Solution Engineer, or a technical customer-facing role, such as working with implementing a SaaS Solution.
* Background working with complex digital products, preferably SaaS solutions.
* Good communication and presentation skills, with the ability to simplify and engage.
* Creative problem-solving skills to address diverse customer needs.
* A team player who values collective success and collaboration.
* Motivated by the challenge of entering new markets and driving growth.
* Experience with CRM systems in the e-commerce industry is highly meritorious (and experience with Voyado Engage specifically is a strong plus).


 As we are growing internationally and have recently established ourselves on the German market, it would be very meritorious if you were fluent in German.
   

  

 What's in it for you?
   

  

 Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers and put a lot of time and effort into keeping and nurturing our knowledge-sharing and friendly culture. We are personal, and that extends into everything about us. Read more about what it is like to work at Voyado
 **here** 
 .
   

  

 More on Voyado!
   

  

 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. We empower retailers and e-commerce companies to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their businesses. We are a purpose-driven company where every opinion is valued, and every team member has the opportunity to make a meaningful impact. At Voyado, you’ll work in a self-driven environment with strong support from your team.
   

  

 Ready to find out more?
   

  

 Lovely! 🎉
   

  

 Before one applies, it can always feel like you need a better resume, more polish, or just another year of experience, but if you think this sounds like a place where you can shine, don't hesitate to send in your resume!
   

  

 We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what you enjoy about your current role and what would be an exciting challenge for you in the future. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let your passion shine through in your application!
   

  

 Additional information
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct a background check on the final candidate. We use background checks from Scandinavian Recruitment Intelligence. Here you can read more about how a background check is done.
   

  

 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado customer experience cloud makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.

title: Sr. Account Executive - Digital Experience
description:
**OPENTEXT**
 OpenText is a global leader in information management, where innovation, creativity, and collaboration are the key components of our corporate culture. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to partner with the most highly regarded companies in the world, tackle complex issues, and contribute to projects that shape the future of digital transformation.
   

  

**Senior Account Executive - Digital Experience**
 The OpenText Experience cloud is focused on selling an industry-leading portfolio of Customer Experience Management (CEM) products. The DX portfolio helps businesses unlock new revenue streams and bolster existing ones, attract and retain customers, and reach new segments—all while driving higher conversion and engagement. Our rich portfolio of Web Content Management, Digital Asset Management, Customer Communication Management, and Workforce Optimization solutions offer exciting and compelling ways to address customer needs.
   

  

**Your Impact**
 As an Account Executive at Open Text you help customers use information to grow faster and be more efficient in an increasingly Digital World. You are part of a global team of highly skilled and entrepreneurial professionals who understand that their customers are experiencing unprecedented change. Your customers trust your judgment to help them solve their most pressing business problems and to support them in their journey to the cloud and to become a digital enterprise. You will stop at nothing to help them find the right solution to positively impact the business, improve their most important business processes, or reduce their risks.
   

  

 You are comfortable with complex sales cycles. Your track record of successful attainment of your targets will be rewarded with one of the most competitive compensation packages in the industry.
   

  

**What The Role Offers**
* Consultative selling and intensely listening to your customers.
* Preparing comprehensive territory plans.
* Identifying and converting opportunities into sales.
* Skillfully executing each phase of the sales process from pipeline generation to closing the deal.
* Masterful client presentations and running effective meetings.
* Clearly articulating the value proposition of solutions and products and the endless possibilities of the digital enterprise to your customers.
* Collaboration across all internal teams and resources to ensure you bring the best solution to your clients.


**What You Need To Succeed**
* A track record of at least five years of B2B selling across the Enterprise.
* Experience working in a consultative capacity with C-level customers on complex cloud-based, on-premises or hybrid solutions.
* Expert knowledge of the B2B buying process and know all your key competitors and closely follow industry trends.
* You deploy advanced sales methodologies and tools to achieve and exceed your targets.
* Whether it’s the challenge of developing new accounts or finding untapped opportunities in your existing client base, the opportunity to grow our business is what drives your efforts every day.
* Intellectual curiosity, easily grasp new products and solutions, and bring the spirit of innovation to your customers.
* Bachelor’s Degree and a passion for continuous learning.


**One Last Thing**
 OpenText is more than just a corporation, it's a global community where trust is foundational, the bar is raised, and outcomes are owned. As an Open Text Account Executive, you drive digital transformation for global clients, solving complex business challenges and accelerating their journey to the cloud. Your consultative expertise and success in complex sales cycles contribute directly to business growth, earning you a competitive compensation package that recognizes your substantial impact in shaping the digital enterprise landscape.
   

  

 OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws.
   

  

 If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or recruiting process, please contact us at hr@opentext.com. Our proactive approach fosters collaboration, innovation, and personal growth, enriching OpenText's vibrant workplace.

title: Senior Backendutvecklare inom webbutveckling sökes för uppdrag hos kund
description:
Uppdraget är till kund i offentlig sektor, med fokus på systemmigrering och teknisk utveckling för digitala kanaler.
   

  

 Du kommer att bli en del av ett etablerat webbteam som arbetar med e-handel, biljetthantering och kundprofilsidor. I det här uppdraget bidrar du särskilt till ett projekt där en befintlig ärendehanteringslösning ska avvecklas och ersättas med ett nytt system. Du är med och säkerställer en

 .

**Backend:** 
 .NET i mikroarkitektur

 React (monorepo), komponentbibliotek baserat på Figma

 Azure, pipelines, automatisering

 Fristående, testbara komponenter med högt fokus på kvalitet och prestanda

Uppdraget utgår från kontor i Stockholm med två fasta kontorsdagar per vecka – övrig tid är flexibel.

title: Team Manager Auxiliary Control – HVDC Control & Protection Software
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


We are looking for an engaging person who wants to grow together with their team and the company. You will be responsible for managing one of our software design and integration teams within the HVDC Control & Protection Software area. The team is responsible for supplying auxiliary control for HVDC projects across the globe including software design, development, integration, testing and verification in real-time and virtual environments.

*“A unique opportunity to be part of an extremely growing and flourishing organization at a company that is at the forefront and holds the number one market position”- Erik Kilander, Global Manager HVDC Control and Protection Software.*

**How you’ll make an impact**

* Through Managing a team of system engineers with responsibility of HVDC auxiliary control software involving design, integration and testing in both virtual and real-time systems.
* Being the owner of the technical function area with responsibility of process adherence and quality assurance
* Establishing and maintain alignment, collaboration, and system support towards neighboring departments
* Being a positive role model for your team by living our vision, delivering promises, and developing people.
* Adapting and implementing strategic initiatives to fit your team to achieve business alignment.
* Planning team composition, development and capabilities needed to meet business needs, in alignment with internal stakeholders and customers.

**Your background**

* You have at least a university degree in Engineering, or equivalent experience from a comparable position
* To successfully take on this position, you probably have experience from supporting and growing team members in an environment with continuously upcoming opportunities and challenges.
* You’ll assess essential aspects of the business and make informed choices in line with the business requirements.
* A motivated leadership is required for this role since the change process takes time and is challenging.
* Good communication skills in Swedish and English, both written and verbal.
* High level of time management skills for you self and when coaching others.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**


Are you ready for a new exciting challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Welcome to apply!. Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


Recruiting Manager Erik Kilander, erik.kilander@hitachienergy.com will answer your questions about the position. title: Senior Imaging Engineer
description:
Job Title
Senior Imaging Engineer
Job Description*Do you want to be where creativity and new ideas are appreciated? Now you have the opportunity to work as Senior Imaging Engineer in Product Platforms Imaging team and lead the development of the base for the world's best surveillance cameras.*
Your future team – Product Platforms Imaging
We are a Product Platform Imaging team that is responsible for the imaging and video algorithms as well as frameworks used in all Axis products based on externally developed chipsets. The work takes place in close collaboration with our partners, Axis product development teams as well as other core technology teams.
Your role as Senior Imaging Engineer
You will work in key areas related to image and video processing with focus on algorithms, image sensors and quality enhancement features. Majority of your time will be spent on design and development of algorithms and frameworks needed to take imaging quality to the next level and make the development process more efficient.
You will be driving high-level strategical direction for the area both in terms of technical roadmap and competence need. This includes monitoring development and new technologies within the imaging area in general, competition offerings as well as having tight collaboration and dialog with other teams in Axis working with relevant technical areas.
You will also be working long term by identifying and ordering development of new technologies, initiatives and projects needed to retain Axis’s leading position within image quality for surveillance in a very competitive worldwide market.
In this position, you will occasionally travel to Axis vendors in US and Asia to evaluate, set requirements, improve, and make sure that we get the best possible quality in Axis products.
Who are you?
You are an energetic and dedicated person with a personal drive and ability to work both unsupervised and as a part of a team. You have a genuine interest in image processing algorithms, image quality evaluation, troubleshooting and software development.
You enjoy sharing your vision and progress with others and by doing so you align with your co-workers towards a common goal. The ability to break down complex issues, organize and structure the work is another important skill needed to be successful in this role.
You have M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree in computer science, physics, mathematics, electrical engineering or similar.
Experience in the following domains is valuable:* Expertise and experience of developing image and video algorithms: auto-exposure, auto-white balance, auto-focus, video stabilization, noise reduction algorithms, HDR algorithms, color mapping/tuning methodologies
* Experience with key building blocks: imaging algorithms, programming of image pipelines, image sensors, optics (solid knowledge from SW to HW)
* Strong understanding of Image Science & Image Quality concepts
* Strong programming skills, e.g. on Linux, C/C++, MATLAB
* Experience from working with technology and platform vendors


The position is office-based, and you will be working at Axis headquarters in Lund, Sweden.
Ready to act?
If you have any questions, please contact recruiting manager, Sabina Ahlberg at +46 46 272 3736.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-05-30*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*

We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
**Software Test Engineer**
==========================

Functional area: Research and Development
Country: Sweden
City: Stockholm
Company name: Atlas Copco Industrial Technique AB
Date of posting: May 2, 2025  

As a global technology leader with over 150 years of innovation, we are driving the development of premium solutions that optimize performance, safety and sustainability in the manufacturing industry. Atlas Copco Industrial Technique’s systems empower global industry users to control assembly processes.  

  

We are looking for a Software Test Engineer. Join our team and enjoy a supportive work environment with opportunities for professional growth and flexible working hours.  

  

**Your role**  

As a test developer in our team, you design, implement and run test scripts that regression test software intended for products that support an automated assembly industry. You work with complex and large embedded industrial systems in cross-functional and agile teams, and are involved in all steps of the process - from first idea to product. The solutions we develop are used to improve efficiency, quality, safety, speed, ergonomics and environmental performance.  

  

**Location:** Stockholm, Nacka  

  

**You will need**


* You hold a masters degree in science within mechatronics/computer science or equivalent and have experience in automatic software test design, programming in Python and from complex or large embedded systems. Preferably you hold an ISTQB certification.
* You can work with test within all abstraction levels in embedded software from low level driver control to application level.
* You are fluent in English.

  




**We offer you**


At Atlas Copco, we value your work and who you are. We believe that the one closest to the problem is the one closest to the solution. We have a collaborative and supportive work environment embracing different perspectives. Our internal job market unlocks opportunities for you to explore and to develop new skills.

  


You are welcome to contact the recruiting manager Razu Khan, razu.khan@atlascopco.com, if you have any questions about the role. We are looking forward to your application via our job site!

  




**Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice**  

Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.
